Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Adecco Milano Sales & Merchandising per Azienda Cliente Multinazionale attiva nel settore farmaceutico ricerca per inserimento un/una:




JUNIOR DATA ANALYST




La risorsa supporter√† il team Global CE Analytics nella gestione di grandi insiemi di dati, supportando la preparazione di business plan, conducendo analisi ad hoc e collaborando con il team del marchio per monitorare le prestazioni dei marchi strategici.




Inoltre si occuper√† di:

Supportare l'organizzazione e la gestione di grandi insiemi di dati interni ed esterni;
Assistere nell'elaborazione e nell'analisi dei dati quantitativi per estrarre informazioni utili. Garantire la qualit√† e l'integrit√† dei dati.
Contribuire all'analisi e al monitoraggio del mercato competitivo per i principali marchi strategici.
Partecipare allo sviluppo e alla preparazione della pianificazione delle entrate (budget e ultime stime).
Mantenere e aggiornare i rapporti sulle prestazioni con particolare attenzione al controllo della qualit√†.
Evolvere i processi attraverso l'automazione per aumentare l'efficienza.







Requisiti richiesti:

Preferibile Laurea/Master in statistica, amministrazione aziendale, economia o campi analitici correlati.
Precedente esperienza di stage o di progetto nell'analisi dei dati o nella business intelligence costituisce un plus.
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese sia scritta che parlata.
Ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office in particolare Excel (funzioni avanzate) e Power Point e conoscenza di Power BI.
Forti competenze quantitative e analitiche, con una comprovata capacit√† di gestire, analizzare e interpretare i dati




Tipologia di inserimento:




Si offre inserimento in contratto di somministrazione con Adecco per l‚ÄôAzienda Cliente di 1 anno, RAL 30K + buoni pasto.




Orario di lavoro Full time dal luned√¨ al venerd√¨ 09.00-18.00




Sede di lavoro: Milano zona Stazione Centrale, con possibilit√† di trasferte sulla sede aziendale a Bologna.







I candidati, nel rispetto del D.lgs. 198/2006, D.lgs 215/2003 e D.lgs 216/2003, sono invitati a leggere l'informativa sulla privacy consultabile sotto il form di richiesta dati della pagina di candidatura (Regolamento UE n. 2016/679).




ATTENZIONE: Abbiamo rilevato la presenza in rete di molti annunci falsi; prendi visione dei nostri consigli per riconoscere i tentativi di truffa sulla pagina dedicata al phishing su adecco.it.

Adecco Italia S.p.A. (Aut. Min. Prot. N.1100-SG del 26.11.2004).

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 6.5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didn‚Äôt stop us from becoming a unicorn ü¶Ñ We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.

This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ‚ô•

Our data team seeks a Data Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with Scalapay‚Äôs key Business Units such as Product, Marketing and Sales, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.

You will:

  • Serve as the data point of reference for our key Business Units, providing them with necessary support;
  • Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement;
  • Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making;
  • Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights;
  • Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data;
  • Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes;
  • Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation;
  • Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay;
  • Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling.

You‚Äôll be great for this role if:

  • You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with a background in startups or fintech;
  • You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus;
  • You are proficient in data visualisation tools and data storytelling;
  • You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses;
  • You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way;
  • You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas;
  • You‚Äôre more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!

Why you should join Scalapay:

  • Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary we have for this position is up to 40'000‚Ç¨ (Gross Annual Base);
  • International environment with significant challenges to be met every day;
  • Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences;
  • Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
  • Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.

Recruitment Process:

  • Initial Chat: A brief conversation with our Talent Acquisition team;
  • Hiring Manager Interview: A deep dive into your experience and motivation for the role;
  • Case Study: A skills-based test with a debriefing session involving key stakeholders;
  • Final Chat with Simone (CEO): An opportunity to discuss Scalapay‚Äôs values and assess cultural alignment.

Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.

Pro tip: send your CV in English üòâ

Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but‚Ä¶ we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.

We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

Title: Junior - Data Analyst
Description:
The chance to build a better future is right in front of you

Do Work That Matters - Il tuo ruolo e le tue responsabilit√†

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse

Il Digital Assurance Team √® un team all‚Äôavanguardia di KPMG in cui diverse competenze collaborano per dare forma alla digitalizzazione del futuro dei servizi di assurance e revisione contabile. A vrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di lavorare a fianco di revisori esperti sviluppando, attraverso la formazione interna ma soprattutto il training on the job, la capacit√† di analizzare criticamente i processi aziendali a supporto dell‚Äôinformativa finanziaria e i dati elaborati dai sistemi informativi delle societ√† identificando elementi di anomalia ed interpretando le dinamiche alla base dei trend economico-finanziari.

Starting date: Settembre 2025

Tipologia di inserimento: Apprendistato

Ufficio: Milano

Nello specifico ti occuperai di:


Sviluppo di soluzioni di analytics a supporto dei team di audit (transactional analytics, dashboard di analisi di dati contabili, process mining, KPI di processo, ecc)
Sviluppo di tecniche di revisione basate sull‚Äôutilizzo di soluzioni tecnologiche innovative
Supporto ai team nell‚Äôutilizzo delle soluzioni proposte
Cura di eventi di comunicazione volti a far conoscere il progetto / le soluzioni


Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche

Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:


Hai una formazione di base economico-contabile
Hai spiccato interesse per l‚Äôarea del reporting finanziario e per i data analytics
Hai voglia di imparare e metterti in gioco
Vuoi crescere all‚Äôinterno di un Network Internazionale


Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG


Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Mindset internazionale e progettualit√† innovative
Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico


Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parit√† di genere.

Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - "GDPR") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG .

KPMG S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.

The chance to build a better future is right in front of you

Responsibilities

Do Work That Matters - Your Role and Responsibilities

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and your colleagues tackle and solve the most current and complex challenges.

The Digital Assurance Team is KPMG‚Äôs innovative team which brings together different skill sets to shape the digitalization of the future for assurance and audit services. You will have the opportunity to work alongside expert auditors ‚Äì through in-house courses and especially on-the-job training ‚Äì developing the ability to critically analyse the company processes used in financial reporting and the information processed by the companies‚Äô IT systems, identifying errors and interpreting the dynamics underlying financial performance.

Starting date: September 2025

Type of contract : Apprenticeship

Office: Milan

Specifically, you will be tasked with:


The development of analytics solutions for audit teams (transactional analytics, dashboards for the analysis of accounting data, process mining, process KPIs, etc.)
The development of audit techniques based on the use of innovative technological solutions
Assistance to the audit teams in using the new solutions
The organization of communication initiatives to raise awareness of the project/solutions.


Skills

Come As You Are - Your Skills and Characteristics

This is the perfect opportunity for you if:


You have a business/accounting background with a degree in business subject
You have a strong interest in financial reporting and data analytics
You have a desire to learn and challenge yourself
You want to grow within an International Network


Your Future With Us - What You Will Find at KPMG


An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages, and values diversity.
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork. [NL1]
Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programs to stay current.
International mindset and innovative projects.
Initiatives focused on physical and mental well-being.


Together for Better ‚Äì Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for individuality, continuous learning, transparency, community engagement, integrity: these are the values of KPMG that create an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, allowing our professionals to express their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality.

Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG‚Äôs privacy policy .

KPMG S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Story so far: Who we are

Founded in August 2020, Huspy started as a digital mortgage platform and quickly evolved into the largest proptech company in the EMEA region. Backed by leading investors such as Sequoia, Balderton, Founders Fund, and Olayan, we have experienced rapid growth with offices in Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Madrid, and Valencia. Our mission is to revolutionize the real estate industry by building an all-in-one super app designed to empower agents and mortgage brokers.

The Main Event: What You‚Äôll Do

At Huspy, our Data team powers growth and innovation by transforming data into actionable insights. As a Senior Data Analyst, you‚Äôll empower both strategic decision-making and product development by delivering robust dashboards, insightful analyses, and data-driven recommendations.

Key Responsibilities:

Design, build, and maintain dashboards in Tableau (preferred) or similar tools to deliver clear, actionable insights.
Extract, clean, and analyze data using SQL and Python from platforms like Snowflake.
Optimize and scale reporting systems for efficiency and accessibility.
Monitor product KPIs such as user engagement, feature usage, and success metrics.
Conduct experiments to guide product decisions and roadmaps.
Analyze user behavior to assess feature performance and optimize rollouts.
Partner with product, engineering, and business teams to align analytics with strategic goals.
Translate business questions into analytical requirements and provide data-driven insights.

The Perfect Match: What You Bring

Experience: 5‚Äì8 years in data analytics or product analytics.


Tools & Technical Skills:


Advanced SQL and Python (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib)


Experience with tools like Tableau, or Looker


Familiarity with product analytics tools such as Amplitude (preferred), Mixpanel, or Google Analytics


Knowledge of Snowflake, dbt, and Airflow for data warehousing and data pipelines


Analytical Strengths:


Strong background in hypothesis testing, and regression analysis


Proven ability to turn complex data into actionable insights


Understanding of ETL and data transformation workflows


Soft Skills:


Excellent communication skills to explain analytical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences


Collaborative mindset and experience working across departments


Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field; Master‚Äôs degree is a plus.


Languages:¬†English proficiency (spoken and written)



What Will Set You Apart

Direct experience with our tech stack: Tableau, Amplitude, Snowflake, dbt, Airflow


Experience in fast-paced, data-driven environments such as startups or PropTech


Strong business acumen with a deep understanding of product and business KPIs

Backed by leading investors such as Sequoia, Balderton, Founders Fund, and Olayan, we have experienced rapid growth with offices in Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Madrid, and Valencia. The Main Event: What You‚Äôll Do

At Huspy, our Data team powers growth and innovation by transforming data into actionable insights. As a Senior Data Analyst, you‚Äôll empower both strategic decision-making and product development by delivering robust dashboards, insightful analyses, and data-driven recommendations.

    • Advanced SQL and Python (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib)

    • Experience with tools like Tableau, or Looker

    • Familiarity with product analytics tools such as Amplitude (preferred), Mixpanel, or Google Analytics

    • Knowledge of Snowflake, dbt, and Airflow for data warehousing and data pipelines

What Will Set You Apart

  • Direct experience with our tech stack: Tableau, Amplitude, Snowflake, dbt, Airflow

  • Experience in fast-paced, data-driven environments such as startups or PropTech

  • Strong business acumen with a deep understanding of product and business KPIs

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst ‚Äì Banking Products & Strategy Support

Location: Brussels, Belgium (Hybrid Work Model)

Employment Type: Full-Time




We are a leading international bank committed to delivering excellent financial services across Europe and beyond. With a strong presence in Brussels, we are focused on innovation, client service, and operational excellence. As part of our continued growth, we are looking for a Data Analyst to support our daily banking product team and strategy execution across our branch network.




Role Overview:

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in translating our daily banking product and owner strategy into actionable insights for our branch network. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze performance, identify opportunities, and support strategic decision-making through data.




Key Responsibilities:

Translate product and strategy goals into measurable KPIs and reporting frameworks.
Analyze customer behavior, product usage, and branch performance to support strategic initiatives.
Build dashboards, reports, and data visualizations using Power BI, Cognos, and Excel.
Develop and maintain data queries using SQL, SAS, and Python to extract and analyze data from various sources.
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and availability for key stakeholders.
Present findings to senior stakeholders in a clear and impactful manner.




Your Profile:

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience (2+ years) in a data analyst or business analyst role, preferably in the banking or financial sector.
Experienced in SQL, SAS, Excel, Cognos, Power BI, and Python.
Ability to turn complex data into clear insights and compelling stories for business stakeholders.
Excellent analytical, organizational, and communication skills.
Fluent in English; knowledge of French and/or Dutch is a strong asset.




What They Offer:

A dynamic and international working environment in the heart of Brussels.
A hybrid work model combining remote work and in-office collaboration.
Opportunities for professional growth and continuous learning.
‚Ç¨70,000+ salary.




If interested, get in touch: Daniel.zelnis@vividresourcing.com

We are a leading international bank committed to delivering excellent financial services across Europe and beyond. With a strong presence in Brussels, we are focused on innovation, client service, and operational excellence. As part of our continued growth, we are looking for a Data Analyst to support our daily banking product team and strategy execution across our branch network.


Role Overview:

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in translating our daily banking product and owner strategy into actionable insights for our branch network. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze performance, identify opportunities, and support strategic decision-making through data.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Translate product and strategy goals into measurable KPIs and reporting frameworks.
  • Analyze customer behavior, product usage, and branch performance to support strategic initiatives.
  • Build dashboards, reports, and data visualizations using Power BI, Cognos, and Excel.
  • Develop and maintain data queries using SQL, SAS, and Python to extract and analyze data from various sources.
  • Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and availability for key stakeholders.
  • Present findings to senior stakeholders in a clear and impactful manner.


Your Profile:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • Proven experience (2+ years) in a data analyst or business analyst role, preferably in the banking or financial sector.
  • Experienced in SQL, SAS, Excel, Cognos, Power BI, and Python.
  • Ability to turn complex data into clear insights and compelling stories for business stakeholders.
  • Excellent analytical, organizational, and communication skills.
  • Fluent in English; knowledge of French and/or Dutch is a strong asset.


What They Offer:

  • A dynamic and international working environment in the heart of Brussels.
  • A hybrid work model combining remote work and in-office collaboration.
  • Opportunities for professional growth and continuous learning.
  • ‚Ç¨70,000+ salary.


  • If interested, get in touch: Daniel.zelnis@vividresourcing.com

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Nexeo Belgium is looking for a Junior Data Analyst to support one of the most advanced data governance programs in the Belgian banking sector.




Mission context

You will be part of the Data Privacy & Regulatory Squad, within the Centre of Expertise (CoE) in Data Governance. This program plays a central role in the bank‚Äôs digital transformation. The team operates in an Agile setup, offering a collaborative and forward-thinking environment. The role combines risk assessment, advisory, and data governance with a focus on privacy and regulatory compliance.

Function description

Risk assessment & governance

Conduct Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) in various contexts (projects, outsourcing, system changes)
Identify privacy-related risks and propose appropriate mitigation measures
Structure and report risks according to internal standards and best practices
Support in handling data incidents and personal data breaches

Advisory & compliance services

Provide consulting services related to data privacy and regulatory requirements
Contribute to the handling of data subject rights requests
Assist in awareness, training, and internal communication on data privacy topics

Your profile

Education

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in law, economics, marketing, communication, or equivalent experience in data (e.g. data analytics, data governance, BI, reporting)

Languages

Dutch: fluent
English: fluent
French: optional

Experience

First professional experience in a similar role, or strong interest in data privacy, data quality, risk management or digital ethics
Good development skills (technical or analytical background preferred)

Soft skills

Team player and proactive mindset
Strong analytical and synthesis skills
Excellent communication and stakeholder management
Autonomous, committed, and resilient
Comfortable in a multicultural, Agile environment

We offer

A hybrid working model: 50% remote / 50% on-site in Brussels
A long-term opportunity in a leading financial institution
A unique chance to grow within a strategic data governance initiative
A collaborative environment focused on innovation, quality, and ethics

Ready to launch your career in data privacy and governance?

Apply now and join Nexeo Belgium!

Title: Data-analyst
Company: Projective Talent | Part of Projective Group
Description:
Location: Brussels (hybrid)

Start date: As soon as possible




Introduction

Are you a highly analytical Data Analyst with a passion for data quality, reporting, and bridging the gap between business and IT? For a leading player in the financial sector, we are looking for a driven Data Analyst who wants to grow in a dynamic environment transitioning from legacy systems to modern cloud solutions.

You will be part of a multidisciplinary team of analysts, developers, and a Scrum Master, where collaboration, continuous improvement, and coaching are central.

This is a 2-year coaching program where you‚Äôll be guided by experienced professionals, with the option to integrate into the client organization upon successful completion.




Your responsibilities

Act as a bridge between business stakeholders and the data team to gather and translate reporting requirements into technical solutions.
Support business needs by delivering structured, cleansed, and high-quality data from various systems and sources.
Develop and maintain reporting solutions, including examples such as a Customer 360¬∞ view.
Contribute to the transition from SAS-based systems to a modern Azure cloud environment.
Perform ETL tasks and write complex SQL queries to extract and transform data.
Cleanse and prepare data to ensure consistency, accuracy, and usability.
Design and implement data models to support business intelligence and analytics.
Structure and consolidate data from multiple sources into coherent datasets.
Document processes and workflows using BPMN (Business Process Model and Notation).
Collaborate within an Agile Scrum team to deliver incremental value.




What we‚Äôre looking for

Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Experience with SQL, data modeling, and data quality.
Familiarity with ETL processes and preferably experience with reporting tools such as Qlik Sense or similar.
Knowledge of or strong interest in Azure-based data solutions.
Strong analytical and communication skills ‚Äì you know how to translate business needs into technical solutions.
Experience with BPMN is a plus.
Fluent in Dutch or French, with a good command of English.




What we offer

A 2-year coaching program in a stimulating and evolving environment.
Intensive support and personal development, with room for autonomy and initiative.
The opportunity to integrate with the client after the program.
A hybrid working setup based in Brussels.
Collaboration within a motivated and multidisciplinary team shaping the future of data-driven decision-making.




Interested?

Ready to grow in an environment where coaching, impact, and development opportunities are key? We‚Äôd love to hear from you ‚Äî let‚Äôs explore the possibilities together.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 2-years experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, ‚Ä¶
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options, you‚Äôre not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
he Tribe Daily Banking & Client First, within the Branch Operations & Sales area, is looking for a Data Analyst I. In this role, you will actively contribute to translating our ‚ÄúTogether for Progress‚Äù strategy into actionable insights for Financial Experts‚Äîmarking a new chapter in our strategic journey ‚ÄúBanking Made Simple.‚Äù

Driven by your passion for

(i) data & reporting,

(ii) customers, and

(iii) branch & digital banking (‚ÄúMobile First‚Äù),

you will support the successful implementation of our Daily Banking product and customer strategy across both statutory and independent branch networks. You‚Äôll do this through factual reporting, proactive in-depth analysis, and strategic advice.

Do you know how to support and challenge ideas with facts and figures? Do you have an innovative mindset? Do you enjoy analyzing and solving business problems? Then we‚Äôre looking for you!

A Day in the Life of a Data Analyst I

As a Data Analyst I, You Will Focus On


Supporting the implementation of our Daily Banking Mobile Led strategy by building and


maintaining insightful reports focused on our Key Performance Indicators using Cognos or other

platforms.


Running a daily data process that automatically updates all linked reports.
Modifying or adding new or updated simple metrics to our data package and process, in close


collaboration with data stakeholders from other product tribes and/or data management.


Proactively analyzing direct metrics and informing stakeholders, often Customer Journey


Experts (CJEs) or Content Managers.


Occasionally handling AMI requests to deliver specific reports.


What Makes You Successful

Together with the team, you take responsibility for maximizing the efficiency and continuous availability of data and performance reports related to all ambitions.


You hold a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Business Administration, Computer Science,


Statistics, or a related field‚Äîor have at least 3 years of equivalent experience.


You are fluent in English; Dutch and/or French are a plus.
You perform sharp analyses based on available data.
You have 1‚Äì2 years of demonstrable experience with data analysis using tools such as SQL,


SAS, Excel, Cognos, Power BI, or Python.


You know how to translate a business question into analytical questions and provide clear,


visually appealing answers.


You are a team player within and beyond your team, with a proactive attitude and a sense of


ownership for assigned projects. You are also happy to work 50% of your time at the newly

renovated Marnix office in Brussels.

As a Data Analyst I at Daily Banking & Client First, You Will:


Play a crucial role in supporting the successful achievement of our commercial growth


objectives in the statutory branch network.


Develop your expertise in a naturally data-driven and evolving domain.
Grow both your analytical and project management skills.
Collaborate with colleagues from the Tribe Daily Banking & Client First, Data Management,


and other product teams.

The Team

The Data Analysts team is responsible for maximizing the impact of the branch network through factual reporting and proactive, in-depth analysis and advice. The team consists of 3 data experts in the roles of data analysts and process managers. They provide Senior Management, Regional and Team Leads, and Financial Experts in our ING branch network with insights to improve daily performance, customer processes, and sales. As part of the Branch Mobile Sales & Business Intelligence domain, the team shares responsibility for strategic development and maximizing customer satisfaction, efficiency, and commercial results at the branch level.

, ING Bank

Title: Junior Data Analyst ‚Äì Starcasino
Description:
Location: Grimbergen

Employment type: Full-time




About Us

Welcome to Starcasino ‚Äì Pioneers in Casino Entertainment

With over 30 years of experience, Starcasino is a leading, family-owned Belgian company in the casino and iGaming industry. Our brands‚Äîincluding Starcasino.be, Hotwin.be, Solcasino.es, and Starcasino.nl‚Äîare well known across Belgium, Spain, and the Netherlands. With more than 10 physical locations and a vibrant online presence, we're always looking for fresh energy to support our mission of delivering next-level gaming experiences.




The Role

We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join our data & insights team. Your primary responsibility will be to support business stakeholders with clear and actionable insights using Metabase. You'll play a key role in helping our teams make smarter decisions based on real data.




What You‚Äôll Do

Create and maintain dashboards and reports in Metabase
Work closely with marketing, product, and operations teams to provide insights and performance tracking
Analyze customer behavior, campaign performance, and platform trends
Assist in A/B testing and experiment evaluation
Ensure data quality and help optimize internal reporting processes




What We‚Äôre Looking For

A degree in a relevant field (e.g. statistics, computer science, economics, or related)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with Metabase (personal projects or internships are welcome)
Good knowledge of SQL
Eagerness to learn, ask questions, and grow within a data-driven environment
Fluent in English; Dutch or French is a plus
Must be based in Belgium and able to work in our office in Grimbergen




What We Offer

A dynamic and collaborative work environment in a growing industry
Competitive salary package with benefits
Full training and guidance from our marketing team.
A look behind the scenes of a fast-growing international company.
Work on-site in Grimbergen, with:
Free lunch every day
Unlimited snacks & drinks
A young, dynamic, and welcoming team




Ready to join the game?

Want to gain real-world data analyst experience and build your portfolio? Join our team and help shape the voice of Starcasino!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a global leading IT company, is recruiting for a Data Analyst to join their business in Belgium.







Position Title:

Data Analyst




Position Type

Permanent




Start Date:

ASAP




Location:

Brussels, Belgium,remote work




Contact:

Davor Molnar | +49 (0) 89 23 88 98 63







Role and Responsibilities




Within the Customer & Usage Experience squad, we are committed to enhancing the experience of Client‚Äôs customers by big data using cutting-edge tools and technologies.
As a data analyst, you will play a key role in identifying new customer & usage experience insights through innovative methods, models, and impactful visualizations, with the objective of driving meaningful improvement initiatives.
You will collaborate closely with BI specialists, data scientists, and big data experts to tackle challenges and achieve measurable results.




Requirements




Hands-on coding experience with SQL and Python (experience with PySpark is a plus).
Proficient in creating Power BI visualizations (knowledge of DAX is a plus).
Experienced with traditional relational databases on-premises, as well as with big-data environments and cloud technologies such as Azure, Cloudera, Hadoop, and Teradata.
Skilled in statistical analysis techniques (e.g., multinomial confidence intervals, correlations, data reduction, clustering, segmentation, Bayesian algorithms, hierarchical regressions, machine learning).
Capable of translating business needs into analytical requests and effectively communicating technical results to non-technical stakeholders through clear and appropriate visualizations.
Result-oriented, with a proven ability to transform data into actionable insights that create business value.
Responsible, result-driven, and passionate about data; a team player who continuously seeks creative solutions and who can also work independently towards high-quality results.
Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience.
Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) and English.
Knowledge of telecommunications and experience with data pipelines creation/maintenance is a plus.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
About us:




Wipro is a leading global information technology, consulting and business process services company. We harness the power of cognitive computing, hyper-automation, robotics, cloud, analytics and emerging technologies to help our clients adapt to the digital world and make them successful. A company recognized globally for its comprehensive portfolio of services, strong commitment to sustainability and good corporate citizenship, we have over 240,000 dedicated employees serving clients across six continents. Together, we discover ideas and connect the dots to build a better and a bold new future.




Project description:




Wipro is supporting an international, globally distributed software vendor in his cloud service area with application management services on top of the latest S/4HANA ABAP technology stack, project specific ABAP applications will get developed and supported in a DevOps approach. The business processes as implemented in project specific ABAP applications are related to data center management, data center operations and IT asset management, we are looking for additional support, to enhance the existing team in a hybrid / remote working model.

Contract duration: 6 months




Key responsibilities:




¬∑ You are the key resource to identify and gather information on existing IT Infrastructure and Cloud Applications

¬∑ You document, visualize and present the results for the development teams

¬∑ You investigate on how to integrate existing IT architectures into the existing CMDB Solution (high level ‚Äì no in-depth technological knowledge necessary)

¬∑ You maintain constant communication with product (SAP Cloud Solutions) teams

¬∑ You create and maintain data models

¬∑ You gain in-depth understanding of various IT environments and architectures (on the job), including Kubernetes environments, to support the infrastructure requirements of the data integration team

¬∑ You work in close collaboration with cross-functional teams incl. the analysis and the work with various data dimensions to ensure data integrity, scalability, and alignment with the business goals

¬∑ You understand and point out dependencies between different systems

¬∑ You are responsible for the creation and maintenance of detailed data flow diagrams

¬∑ You validate data from existing integrations for accuracy and consistency

¬∑ You will work with various data dimensions and document use cases




Requirements:




¬∑ You are strong in analytical thinking

¬∑ You pick up and adapt new information easily

¬∑ You have profound documentation, modeling and data processing skills

¬∑ You are capable of independently researching and understanding new topics as needed

¬∑ You are profound in requirements engineering and can submit DEV requests to the development teams as needed.

¬∑ You have a foundational understanding of IT Asset Management, (virtual) servers, databases

¬∑ You have the ability to map dependencies between systems and determine appropriate data sources for different use cases

¬∑ Ideally you¬¥ve previously gained experience in creating data flow diagrams as part of system integration processes

¬∑ You have a high sense of responsibility and very good communication skills. You are reliable and a team player

¬∑ You act in a committed, proactive, flexible and resilient manner

¬∑ You have good language and presentation skills in English




Location:




Remote - across European Union countries




This position offers a chance to be part of a forward-thinking company that values innovation and a progressive approach to technology. Interested candidates are encouraged to apply and join the team where they can make a significant impact.

Wipro is an advocate for positive change and conscious inclusion. As a global employer, we strive to create a diverse Wipro family by remaining committed to the development of our culture, diversity, equality, and inclusion in the workplace. All applicants welcome.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role And Responsibilities

Data Analyst - Customer & Usage Experience

Within the Customer & Usage Experience squad, we are committed to enhancing the experience by big data using cutting-edge tools and technologies.

As a data analyst, you will play a key role in identifying new customer & usage experience insights through innovative methods, models, and impactful visualizations, with the objective of driving meaningful improvement initiatives.

You will collaborate closely with BI specialists, data scientists, and big data experts to tackle challenges and achieve measurable results.

Your Profile


Hands-on coding experience with SQL and Python (experience with PySpark is a plus).
Proficient in creating in Power BI visualizations (knowledge of DAX is a plus).
Experienced with traditional relational databases on-premises, as well as with big-data environments and cloud technologies such as Azure, Cloudera, Hadoop, and Teradata.
Skilled in statistical analysis techniques (e.g., multinomial confidence intervals, correlations, data reduction, clustering, segmentation, Bayesian algorithms, hierarchical regressions, machine learning).
Capable of translating business needs into analytical requests and effectively communicating technical results to non-technical stakeholders through clear and appropriate visualizations.
Result-oriented, with a proven ability to transform data into actionable insights that create business value.
Responsible, result-driven, and passionate about data; a team player who continuously seeks creative solutions and who can also work independently towards high-quality results.
Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience.
Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) and English.
Knowledge of telecommunications and experience with data pipelines creation/maintenance is a plus.


Show more

Role And Responsibilities

Data Analyst - Customer & Usage Experience

Within the Customer & Usage Experience squad, we are committed to enhancing the experience by big data using cutting-edge tools and technologies.

As a data analyst, you will play a key role in identifying new customer & usage experience insights through innovative methods, models, and impactful visualizations, with the objective of driving meaningful improvement initiatives.

You will collaborate closely with BI specialists, data scientists, and big data experts to tackle challenges and achieve measurable results.

Your Profile

  • Hands-on coding experience with SQL and Python (experience with PySpark is a plus).
  • Proficient in creating in Power BI visualizations (knowledge of DAX is a plus).
  • Experienced with traditional relational databases on-premises, as well as with big-data environments and cloud technologies such as Azure, Cloudera, Hadoop, and Teradata.
  • Skilled in statistical analysis techniques (e.g., multinomial confidence intervals, correlations, data reduction, clustering, segmentation, Bayesian algorithms, hierarchical regressions, machine learning).
  • Capable of translating business needs into analytical requests and effectively communicating technical results to non-technical stakeholders through clear and appropriate visualizations.
  • Result-oriented, with a proven ability to transform data into actionable insights that create business value.
  • Responsible, result-driven, and passionate about data; a team player who continuously seeks creative solutions and who can also work independently towards high-quality results.
  • Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience.
  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) and English.
  • Knowledge of telecommunications and experience with data pipelines creation/maintenance is a plus.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Nexeo is currently looking for a Data Analyst (Freelance or permanent) for a market leader in the banking industry in Belgium.




Nexeo Belgium is a consultancy company that supports its clients in the banking, finance and insurance sectors in all phases of their transformation projects: from business consulting to the implementation of IT solutions.¬†




As a consultant you will have the opportunity to be part of Nexeo:

International environment ( Offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland & Canada)
+ 450 employees
over 20% growth each year




The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.¬†

¬†

Responsibilities

Understand the day-to-day issues that the bank faces
Performs cleansing of data quality issues through the analysi
Monitors the data quality based on data quality dashboards, supports redesign & upgrade
Contributes to designing, monitoring and reporting on common reference tools
Contributes to raising awareness of the importance of data quality
Will be involved in all the topics related to Customer Data
Business Analysis
Work in collaboration with other technical teams to share data
Data extraction with SAS
Industrialize the process to run define periodicity
Document the project (functional and technical part)
Contribute to the achievement of the team objectives




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree
At least 3 years¬†of experience in Data Analysis (focus data quality & data governance)
Understand data lifecycle and data usage
Working in Agile environnement (Jira & Scrum)
Good experience working with SQL Queries & SAS
English Fluent & French or Dutch native

Title: Data Analyst - Quality Expert
Description:
Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert

Unleash your data Quality enthusiasm!




Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.




So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner. With a squad of over 120 consultants, we're on a mission to unravel the secrets of data and lead businesses from all walks of life through the digital wilderness. Join LACO, and you're not just an employee: you're family. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do, making every day at LACO a thrilling adventure.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst with focus on Quality at LACO, you‚Äôll be responsible for:




Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
Build (Power BI) data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS




You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
You have proven experience with data quality projects.
You have an extended experience with Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Lineage or Reporting Governance
You know all about the SQL
You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modeling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.




You get even more bonus points if ‚Ä¶




You have a good Experience with master data management
You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
Python, Spark, PySpark, Spark SQL
Other Security protocols like CLS (column Level Security, Object Level Security)
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER




Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
Have a say in which project placement you‚Äôll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, ‚Ä¶




Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our one and only Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data & MLOps Engineer - Brussels area- Hybrid way of working -ASAP - 3 months with the possibility to be extended




*Only candidates living in Belgium are considered for this position*

*Only people being on payroll or ZZP can be considered for this position*




Are you a Data/MLOps Engineer with experience in Databricks and Azure Data Lake?

If so, this opportunity could be perfect for you!

Amoria Bond is currently seeking a Data/MLOps Engineer to join one of our key clients in the Brussels area.

As part of a dynamic team, you will design and build data pipelines and data models to support analytics and Power BI dashboards.

Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines
Build and optimize data models for Power BI and analytics
Use Terraform to manage infrastructure as code
Utilize GitHub for version control

Qualifications:

Proficient in Python and SQL
Experience with Spark (PySpark)
Hands-on experience with Databricks
Knowledge of Azure Data Factory and Azure Data Lake
Familiarity with GitHub
Strong understanding of data modeling concepts







Are you the Data/MLOps Engineer that we are looking for? Send your CV (in Dutch) and contact details to meel.polkki@amoriabond.com and I will contact you as soon as I can!




We will endeavour to respond to your application ASAP. However, there may be times when it is not possible to reply to all applications, due to high volumes of enquiries. This is sometimes the case for unsuccessful applications to one of our vacancies. We apologise for this and can reassure you that we will keep your details and contact you in the future should any suitable positions arise.




Amoria Bond operates as an employment agency and employment business. No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age or experience, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from persons of any age or experience for this role.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Company

We are currently looking for a Marketing Data Analyst for a leading company in the media sector. This organization works on a variety of projects where data, strategy, and creativity come together. Operating in a dynamic environment, the focus is on innovation, collaboration, and generating relevant insights.




Job description

As a Marketing Data Analyst, you are responsible for collecting, analysing, and structuring marketing data. Your insights support targeted campaigns and help various teams make well-informed decisions.

A key part of your role involves managing and further developing an internal product used for audience-focused location analysis. Using data, you determine which screens or locations are best suited to reach specific target groups. You optimize the performance of this product and contribute strategically to its improvement.

You‚Äôll work closely with teams such as Sales, IT, Planning, and Development. In this versatile and connecting role, you‚Äôll enjoy a high level of autonomy and make a real impact.




Profile

You have strong analytical skills and are proficient in Excel; knowledge of a data visualization tool (such as Power BI) is a strong plus.
You have a clear interest in or affinity with marketing.
You are customer-oriented and enjoy providing tailored solutions.
You thrive in a collaborative, multidisciplinary environment and communicate clearly.
You speak Dutch or French and have a good working knowledge of English.




Offer

This international company is characterized by a familial and open atmosphere. You have a high level of impact in your role ‚Äî illustrated by the fact that you can simply walk into the CEO‚Äôs office if you have a great idea.

In addition, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to take ownership of one of their new tools and truly make a difference with your work.




Are you passionate about data and naturally curious?

Send your resume to delphine@cartiere.be and call +32 33 43 94 92 for more information.

Visit our website www.cartiere.be for more BI, data, AI and ML-opportunities.

Title: Job | BI Analyst | Brussels
Description:
Looking for a new challenge in Data? Look no further, we have just the job for you.

DKV Belgium, a loyal partner in insurance, but there‚Äôs more than meets the eye ‚Äîwe‚Äôre a dynamic team of around 500 engaged colleagues driving digital transformation. As part of the international Munich Re Group, we proudly lead private health insurance in Belgium, supporting our clients during good and difficult times. You will arrive in an environment where everybody is able to be who they are, where you can get the most out of yourself day in and day out, with the support of your colleagues.

Are you passionate about turning data into actionable insights? Do you enjoy building dashboards that help teams make smarter decisions and innovate with tools like Power BI and AI, while also ensuring compliance to regulations such as the GDPR and AI Act?

Sounds like you? Continue reading!

What The Key Tasks Will Look Like

We‚Äôre looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst (Developer) who excels at transforming complex data into actionable insights and -ultimately - business value. If you‚Äôre eager to work on impactful missions, collaborate across departments, and shape the future of BI at DKV‚Äîthis could be your next step.


Design, develop, and implement advanced Business Intelligence solutions that drive business value. For example; KPI reporting on performance or insights for better workforce planning or processes management augmentation.
Create, manage and oversee DKV‚Äôs reference report repository, by collecting, transforming, and structuring data from internal and external sources.
Define, maintain and train BI standards and documentation.
Act as a business partner, supporting data literacy, adoption of analytics and a data-driven culture across the organization. Anticipate future reporting needs and proactively propose solutions.
Stay up to date with the latest BI developments and proactively apply them to DKV‚Äôs context, including AI and GenAI applications.



Required Skills And Competencies

Background and personal skills


You have a Master‚Äôs degree in Business Intelligence & Analytics, Data Science, Business Information Management or comparable (e.g. econometrics, applied Statistics, artificial intelligence, computer science ) , or equivalent in experience, with at least 2 years relevant experience. A background in health insurance or healthcare is a plus. Project/consulting experience is highly valued.
You have a strong methodological and quantitative way of thinking, with solid conceptual and practical problem-solving abilities.
You are structured and precise in your approach, with a sharp eye for quality and potential weaknesses in your work products, including those of colleagues.
You take initiative and work autonomously, while knowing when to align or ask for support or review and just as willing to offer one. You also have strong collaboration skills; you are good with business as well as IT.
You excel in communication and presentation skills; you are able to translate complex data into clear insights and present them with impact to both technical and non-technical audiences, including senior management.
You have an excellent command of English and Dutch and/or French, both written as spoken, and you are able to communicate with all levels within the company ranging from business user to top management.
You‚Äôre eager to learn and understand how the company works and how data can make a difference. You are able to build trust within the organization.
You thrive in a dynamic environment, have a talent for organizing and can handle pressure with ease.
You can work with large and sensitive datasets. You understand that, therefore, you are bound to regulations such as the GDPR and AI Act



Technical Skills


Proficient in Power BI, SQL, DAX and data modeling (mandatory).
Strong experience with ETL processes and data preparation (of data residing in our DWH ‚Äì managed by IT- or on standalone data sources).
Some experience with Python and tools like Visual Studio Code, Git, Bitbucket.
Up to date with BI trends, including application of predictive analytics and generative AI in the BI domain.



Want to grow with us?

At DKV we offer you a varied job with growth opportunities (thanks to training, coaching, growth projects, and internal mobility) and all this at a prime location in the heart of Brussels.

Besides a competitive gross salary, we offer an extensive standard package of extra-legal benefits such as:


insurance package (hospitalization, ambulatory insurance, guaranteed income insurance, pension plan)
a year-end premium, collective company premium, and individual bonus
flex reward-plan
meal and eco vouchers
internet and homeworking allowance
car or mobility budget



Moreover, you can count on an attractive leave scheme (up to 34 days), flexible working hours, and the possibility to work from home up to three days a week. This way of hybrid working guarantees you a good balance between work and your private life.

We are an equal-opportunity employer. All aspects of employment are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs. If you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can make any reasonable adjustments needed to support you through your recruitment journey.
Show more
HTML:
Looking for a new challenge in Data? Look no further, we have just the job for you.

DKV Belgium, a loyal partner in insurance, but there‚Äôs more than meets the eye ‚Äîwe‚Äôre a dynamic team of around 500 engaged colleagues driving digital transformation. As part of the international Munich Re Group, we proudly lead private health insurance in Belgium, supporting our clients during good and difficult times. You will arrive in an environment where everybody is able to be who they are, where you can get the most out of yourself day in and day out, with the support of your colleagues.

Are you passionate about turning data into actionable insights? Do you enjoy building dashboards that help teams make smarter decisions and innovate with tools like Power BI and AI, while also ensuring compliance to regulations such as the GDPR and AI Act?

Sounds like you? Continue reading!

What The Key Tasks Will Look Like

We‚Äôre looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst (Developer) who excels at transforming complex data into actionable insights and -ultimately - business value. If you‚Äôre eager to work on impactful missions, collaborate across departments, and shape the future of BI at DKV‚Äîthis could be your next step.

  • Design, develop, and implement advanced Business Intelligence solutions that drive business value. For example; KPI reporting on performance or insights for better workforce planning or processes management augmentation.
  • Create, manage and oversee DKV‚Äôs reference report repository, by collecting, transforming, and structuring data from internal and external sources.
  • Define, maintain and train BI standards and documentation.
  • Act as a business partner, supporting data literacy, adoption of analytics and a data-driven culture across the organization. Anticipate future reporting needs and proactively propose solutions.
  • Stay up to date with the latest BI developments and proactively apply them to DKV‚Äôs context, including AI and GenAI applications.


Required Skills And Competencies

Background and personal skills

  • You have a Master‚Äôs degree in Business Intelligence & Analytics, Data Science, Business Information Management or comparable (e.g. econometrics, applied Statistics, artificial intelligence, computer science ) , or equivalent in experience, with at least 2 years relevant experience. A background in health insurance or healthcare is a plus. Project/consulting experience is highly valued.
  • You have a strong methodological and quantitative way of thinking, with solid conceptual and practical problem-solving abilities.
  • You are structured and precise in your approach, with a sharp eye for quality and potential weaknesses in your work products, including those of colleagues.
  • You take initiative and work autonomously, while knowing when to align or ask for support or review and just as willing to offer one. You also have strong collaboration skills; you are good with business as well as IT.
  • You excel in communication and presentation skills; you are able to translate complex data into clear insights and present them with impact to both technical and non-technical audiences, including senior management.
  • You have an excellent command of English and Dutch and/or French, both written as spoken, and you are able to communicate with all levels within the company ranging from business user to top management.
  • You‚Äôre eager to learn and understand how the company works and how data can make a difference. You are able to build trust within the organization.
  • You thrive in a dynamic environment, have a talent for organizing and can handle pressure with ease.
  • You can work with large and sensitive datasets. You understand that, therefore, you are bound to regulations such as the GDPR and AI Act


Technical Skills

  • Proficient in Power BI, SQL, DAX and data modeling (mandatory).
  • Strong experience with ETL processes and data preparation (of data residing in our DWH ‚Äì managed by IT- or on standalone data sources).
  • Some experience with Python and tools like Visual Studio Code, Git, Bitbucket.
  • Up to date with BI trends, including application of predictive analytics and generative AI in the BI domain.


Want to grow with us?

At DKV we offer you a varied job with growth opportunities (thanks to training, coaching, growth projects, and internal mobility) and all this at a prime location in the heart of Brussels.

Besides a competitive gross salary, we offer an extensive standard package of extra-legal benefits such as:

  • insurance package (hospitalization, ambulatory insurance, guaranteed income insurance, pension plan)
  • a year-end premium, collective company premium, and individual bonus
  • flex reward-plan
  • meal and eco vouchers
  • internet and homeworking allowance
  • car or mobility budget


Moreover, you can count on an attractive leave scheme (up to 34 days), flexible working hours, and the possibility to work from home up to three days a week. This way of hybrid working guarantees you a good balance between work and your private life.

We are an equal-opportunity employer. All aspects of employment are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs. If you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can make any reasonable adjustments needed to support you through your recruitment journey.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
A leading company in the online gaming and betting industry is looking for a mid-to-senior level

Product Analyst to join their team remotely. This role focuses on supporting product teams with

analytics, reporting, and actionable insights to drive strategic decisions.




‚Ä¢ Contract: B2B in Europe or regular employment in the UK/Gibraltar

‚Ä¢ Up to ‚Ç¨70,000 / ¬£60,000




Desired experience:

‚Ä¢ 5+ years in data roles

‚Ä¢ 2+ years in iGaming or sportsbook.

‚Ä¢ Experience with R, Python, or similar for data analysis and manipulation.

‚Ä¢ Excellent SQL skills and experience building dashboards in Tableau.

‚Ä¢ Effective communicator with the capability to explain technical analyses and insights to nontechnical audiences.




Main Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Actively participate in business initiatives from the product perspective, including evaluating potential business impact, defining data and reporting needs, and developing frameworks to measure success.

‚Ä¢ Design and implement reporting solutions in Tableau and other tools to analyze the performance of product features, customer journeys, and behavioral metrics.

‚Ä¢ Scope, plan, and perform A/B tests and various analyses, translating results into clear, actionable recommendations for product stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ Contribute to the development and deployment of a robust analytics layer for A/B testing processes.

‚Ä¢ Take ownership of maintaining and enhancing reporting systems and dashboards used by product teams.

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI-expert
Description:
Gezocht: Data Analyst / Power BI-expert met goesting voor data en impact

Locatie: Belgi√´ | Fulltime | Mid-senior niveau




Jouw uitdaging

Ben jij een kei in datavisualisatie en heb je een neus voor heldere inzichten? Heb je Power BI volledig in de vingers en wil je meebouwen aan datagedreven oplossingen die √©cht het verschil maken? Dan ben jij misschien wel de collega die we zoeken voor ons Microsoft-team bij LACO!




Over LACO

LACO is al meer dan 35 jaar een gevestigde waarde in de wereld van data-intelligence. Als trotse Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner begeleiden we onze klanten door hun volledige datareis ‚Äî van strategie tot implementatie.




Ons team van 120+ gepassioneerde consultants werkt dagelijks aan innovatieve projecten in o.a. Power BI, Data Governance en het Microsoft-ecosysteem. We combineren diepgaande expertise met een warme, collegiale cultuur waarin plezier en professionaliteit perfect samenhangen.




Wat ga je doen als Data Analyst / Power BI-expert?

Je wordt een sleutelfiguur in het realiseren van end-to-end data-oplossingen:

Je analyseert de businessbehoeften en vertaalt ze naar datagedreven oplossingen.
Je verzamelt, verwerkt en optimaliseert data uit verschillende bronnen.
Je bouwt visueel sterke en functionele dashboards in Power BI die bedrijven √©cht vooruithelpen.
Je werkt nauw samen met stakeholders en collega‚Äôs uit verschillende disciplines.
Je lost data-uitdagingen op en zet complexe datasets om in heldere inzichten.
Je blijft up-to-date met de nieuwste features binnen Power BI & Microsoft Fabric.




Wat breng je mee?

Je hebt een bachelor of master in (toegepaste) informatica of een gelijkaardig domein.
Minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Power BI Developer of vergelijkbaar.
Je denkt analytisch, werkt oplossingsgericht en bent een teamspeler.
Je beheerst SQL, DAX en Power BI tot in de puntjes.
Je bent vertrouwd met datamodellering (Kimball, Dimensional Modeling, Data Vault).
Je weet hoe je complexe data omzet naar heldere visualisaties.




Extra punten als je ook ‚Ä¶

Ervaring hebt met Azure Synapse, Data Factory of Databricks.
Comfortabel bent met verschillende soorten datastorage.
Zowel in het Nederlands als Engels vlot communiceert.




Wat bieden wij jou?

Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met o.a. 32 vakantiedagen, bedrijfswagen, ‚Ä¶
Een persoonlijke opleidings- en groeitraject (met focus op certificeringen).
Flexibiliteit: of je nu als werknemer of freelancer werkt ‚Äî wij staan open voor beide.
Uitdagende projecten in een moderne Microsoft-omgeving.
Een warme bedrijfscultuur waar ook ruimte is voor fun: skitrips, familiedagen, sportactiviteiten, spelavonden ‚Ä¶




Klinkt dit als iets voor jou?

Solliciteer vandaag nog en geef jouw datatalent de ruimte om te groeien!

Ons Talent Acquisition-team kijkt er alvast naar uit je te leren kennen.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Alken-Maes has a centralized team for Business Intelligence (BI). This team‚Äôs primary responsibility is to accelerate insights collection, creation & delivery to internal stakeholders. In this team, Business & Data Analysts work closely together. This allows us to develop fit-for-purpose solutions in a consistent manner.




What started as volume vs. market tracking, has grown into a broader mission: helping our business make better decisions, faster. The goal? Expand our impact and bring data magic to more corners of Alken-Maes, while learning from other HEINEKEN OpCos along the way.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst, you help shape our ambition to become a truly data-driven company. You‚Äôll start as a key business partner for Sales & Marketing.




Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll do:

Ensure our Power BI reports run smoothly: reliable, clear, fast, and insightful.
Constantly improve our reporting landscape: smarter data sources, better visualizations, sharper insights.
Coach colleagues to explore data on their own, turning dashboards into daily habits.







YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES




1.Make data a mindset:

Use data to support, challenge and inspire our business stakeholders with actionable information and insights about our (commercial) tactics.
Support campaigns and commercial initiatives by uncovering what (doesn‚Äôt) work through concrete numbers and clear insights.
Inspire teams with what‚Äôs possible: proactively sharing new tools, views, or data sources that could unlock smarter ways of working.
Help translate consumer behavior and commercial performance into actionable plans that grow our brands in Off-Trade (supermarkets) and On-Trade (bars, restaurants, festivals).

2. Maintain existing reporting landscape & run several data-driven projects to deliver actionable insights based on key business questions

Participate in the development of our data-driven learning agenda.
Engage a fruitful and effective collaboration with Global Analytics teams to be on top of Global models‚Äô deployment.
Maintain and improve recurring reporting in Power BI, always looking for ways to make it cleaner, faster, and more relevant.
Work closely with business stakeholders to deeply understand their needs and turn them into dashboards that help them work better.
Turn results of analytics into actionable insights.
Help business users get more confident in using dashboards, tools and insights independently.




YOUR PROFILE




You hold a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, IT, Analytics, Marketing or a related field.
You bring 2‚Äì4 years of professional experience, with at least 2 years hands-on in a data analyst or BI-related role.
You‚Äôre technically skilled:
SQL
Visualization Tools : Power BI preferred, others acceptable.
Microsoft Office: Excel & PowerPoint
Advanced analytics is a plus
Your experience has taught you how to:
Manage a reporting landscape: ensure quality, work on continuous improvement for recurring reporting, convert business requirements into tangible reports/dashboards.
Connect & collaborate with stakeholders: it‚Äôs the responsibility of people that speak ‚Äòdata‚Äô to communicate this simply to business stakeholders.
Take ownership of projects: own the delivery of projects.
You‚Äôre a bright analytical thinker and problem solver with eye for detail.
You‚Äôre a natural communicator: you can explain complex data to non-technical audiences with ease and confidence.
You take ownership of your work: you‚Äôre someone who gets things moving and delivers.
You are flexible in changing environments.
You have a good knowledge of English or Dutch.
Most of all: you‚Äôre curious, eager to learn and ready to grow‚Ä¶ just like us.




What's in it for you?

Trust, challenge and support from experienced managers and professionals who know how to develop people, teams and take organizations to the next level.
We are the market challenger. This means we are a dynamic, local organization; with the benefits of belonging to the larger, international HEINEKEN family.
Awesome colleagues who enjoy a refreshing Cristal or Desperados 0% after work.
The opportunity to make your mark and take the initiative. (Which, according to our colleagues, is one of the greatest advantages of working at Alken-Maes).
A coaching environment, giving you an extraordinary learning opportunity.
And of course, a competitive package and other nice conditions.
Meal vouchers
Hospitalisation plan
Group insurance
33 leave days
Mobility options

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues üòÄ




WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Teddy, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).




YOUR TASKS :

Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs
Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
Collaborate with the development team




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is also required
You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client‚Äôs request

Bonus

An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting‚Ä¶ could be a real asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you‚Äôre not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Business & Data Analyst
Description:
Tasks


Support and guidance in using the Atlassian Stack for the implementation of DevSecOps
Definition of best practices for requirements management, architecture, development and testing
Tailoring of all processes to cover a product approach using Atlassian stack
Analysis of the data managed by the 3 systems, with definition of data governance.
Definition of existing business processes for the management of programme (including all underlying activities), training and collaborative activities.
Reengineering of theses business processes
Definition of integration processes between these 3 systems
Code review (PHP)
Quality assurance and quality control by reviewing the deliverables
Service management
Interaction with the business analysts, customer, users, project leaders and the developers


Requirements


B2 level of English minimum. Any knowledge of French is an asset.
Minimum 3 years‚Äô recent practical experience in data and process modelling.
Knowledge and experience in tools supporting processes, service and data analysis activities such as ARIS (from Software AG), the IBM Rational tool suite, etc..
Experience in a public administration, preferably customs, taxation/finance or climate is an asset.
Ability to quickly acquire the knowledge of the required methodologies to be applied and prescribed by the Contracting Authority (DG TAXUD EU BPM Methodology, TEMPO, RUP@EC and any successors of these methodologies).
Analytical skills and capability to analyse problems in detail.
Ability to present results in a structured and consistent manner.
Minimum 5 years of experience with Atlassian Stack
Minimum 3 years of experience in quality control and quality assurance
Minimum 3 years of experience in Project Management
Minimum 3 years of experience in programming (any language)
Minimum 3 years of experience in databases (any DB)
Good knowledge of PHP and Java
