  • Knowledge and experience in tools supporting processes, service and data analysis activities such as ARIS (from Software AG), the IBM Rational tool suite, etc..
  • Experience in a public administration, preferably customs, taxation/finance or climate is an asset.
  • Ability to quickly acquire the knowledge of the required methodologies to be applied and prescribed by the Contracting Authority (DG TAXUD EU BPM Methodology, TEMPO, RUP@EC and any successors of these methodologies).
  • Analytical skills and capability to analyse problems in detail.
  • Ability to present results in a structured and consistent manner.
  • Minimum 5 years of experience with Atlassian Stack
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in quality control and quality assurance
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in Project Management
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in programming (any language)
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in databases (any DB)
  • Good knowledge of PHP and Java

Title: Data Analytics Consultant
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven‚ÄØby responsibility.‚ÄØWe‚Äôre optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate‚ÄØand benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a‚ÄØforce multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and‚ÄØmaximize opportunity.‚ÄØ



With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in‚ÄØ19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.





Job Description



Your Role



As a Data Analytics Consultant, you will be at the heart of delivering impactful data-driven strategies to our clients. You will collaborate closely with local and international clients to bridge the gap between business objectives and technical execution.



You will help deliver actionable data-driven solutions & insights, and present the results in an interactive, easily understandable manner.



What you will do



Collaborate with stakeholders to define business goals and shape solution blueprints through workshops and mock-ups.



Prepare and validate data by mapping, extracting, cleaning, enriching, and performing feature engineering to establish stable datasets for analysis.



Design, implement, and automate interactive dashboards and customized reports that cater to specific client requirements using advanced visualization tools.



Conduct comprehensive statistical analysis and exploratory data investigations to extract actionable insights supporting decision-making.



Translate complex technical and analytical findings into clear, understandable presentations for non-technical stakeholders.



Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analytics, applying innovative approaches to enhance service offerings.



Provide guidance and support to business users and team members in leveraging data effectively, contributing to a data-driven culture and continuous learning.



Within Sia, you will



Contribute to enhancing Sia‚Äôs Data Science and Generative AI offerings through internal training sessions, working groups, and publications.



Represent Sia at professional events, actively contributing to thought leadership (articles, white papers, webinars).



Support business development by crafting proposals/offers, identifying collaboration opportunities, and nurturing long-term client relationships.





Qualifications



About You



You bring:



A Master's degree in Business, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.



0‚Äì3 years of experience in data analytics or a relevant consulting or industry role.



Fluency in Dutch or French, and English.



Strategic thinking with strong analytical skills and a proactive approach.



Experience in clearly communicating and presenting complex ideas to varied audiences.



Efficient collaboration with various stakeholders, internally and externally, to gather requirements and support data-driven decisions.



Eagerness to work alongside and learn from more experienced colleagues while contributing fresh ideas to team projects.



Interest in applying innovative analytics and AI solutions to drive sustainability and create meaningful business impact.



Your technical toolkit:



Hands-on experience with Python or R for data analysis.



Proficiency with SQL and Microsoft Excel for data manipulation.



Familiarity with dashboarding tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.



Knowledge of cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a strong plus.





Additional Information



Unfortunately, we are unable to provide a work permit for this position.



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: Insurance Data Analyst
Description:
Insurance Data Analyst - permanent contract

*sponsorship not provided*




Location: Brussels




Language Requirements: Fluent in Dutch or French & proficient in English (essential)




Industry Experience: Insurance (essential)




Are you passionate about turning complex data into meaningful insights that drive business decisions? This dynamic consultancy looking for a Data Analyst to join their team in the insurance sector. If you enjoy working with large datasets, uncovering trends, and supporting strategic initiatives with data-driven recommendations‚Äîthis is your opportunity to make a real impact in a forward-thinking and agile business.




What You‚Äôll Do

As an Insurance Data Analyst, you will play a key role in helping the team understand the data and transform it into actionable insights. You‚Äôll work with cross-functional teams, apply statistical methods, and use visualization tools to communicate your findings to stakeholders at all levels.




Your Key Responsibilities:

Data Collection & Preparation:

Gather and clean data from multiple sources (databases, APIs, spreadsheets) to ensure accuracy and usability.

Analysis & Insight Generation:

Use statistical techniques to explore and interpret data, identifying patterns, trends, and correlations.

Visualization & Reporting:

Build compelling dashboards and visual reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib.

Stakeholder Communication:

Present findings in a clear, concise manner to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Strategic Collaboration:

Work with internal teams to understand business needs and deliver data-backed solutions that drive performance and growth.

Continuous Improvement:

Stay current on new technologies and trends in data analytics and bring innovative thinking to the team.




What You Bring

Proficiency in SQL and data querying techniques
Experience with Python or R for data analysis
Strong skills in data visualization and reporting tools
Solid understanding of statistics, data modelling, and data warehousing concepts
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities
Strong communication and presentation skills
Independent, detail-oriented, and eager to learn
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field
Master‚Äôs degree or relevant certifications are a plus
Fluency in Dutch or French, with good command of English

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Function

Advisory - Advisor

Roles & Responsibilities

At KPMG, we believe in harnessing the power of data to drive better business decisions. Our team of consultants works alongside clients to help them transform raw data into actionable insights that fuel strategic growth. As a global leader in audit, tax, and advisory services, we combine deep industry expertise with cutting-edge technologies to deliver innovative solutions.

Role Overview

As a Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant, you will play a key role in helping our clients unlock the potential of their data. You will work on a variety of projects across different industries, focusing on improving decision-making processes, enhancing reporting capabilities, and developing data-driven strategies. You will collaborate closely with both internal teams and clients to ensure that data is collected, structured, and visualized in a way that drives value.

Key Responsibilities


Partner with clients to understand their data challenges and business objectives
Design and implement BI solutions, including dashboards and reports
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and optimize data models
Conduct data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and insights
Provide recommendations to improve data management and reporting processes
Stay updated with the latest BI tools and technologies
Contribute to project management by ensuring timely and quality delivery


Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications


Strong experience in data analysis, reporting, and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik) Proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques
Ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights
Good communication skills to interact effectively with clients and teams
A passion for problem-solving and a detail-oriented approach
Team player with a collaborative mindset
Willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges
A good communication knowledge of Dutch & English


We offer


A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other‚Äôs beliefs and background.
Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.

Title: Data Analyst

Een partner zijn voor de business bij het defini√´ren & challengen van nieuwe incentives of compensatieplannen

Master in een relevante richting (Handelsingenieur, Toegepaste Economie, Computerwetenschappen, Informatiemanagement...) of gelijkwaardig door ervaring
Minstens 2 jaar ervaring in een data-analist, business insights, business intelligence of gelijkaardige rol
Goede kennis van SQL, MS Excel, Qlik Sense of gelijkaardige tools
Sterke interesse in optimalisatiemogelijkheden en gestructureerde probleemoplossing
Uitstekende presentatie- en vertelvaardigheden en het vermogen om beslissingsnemers te be√Ønvloeden
Domeinkennis en ervaring in een businessfunctie in Telecom, Entertainment of gelijkaardige industrie√´n is een pluspunt
Ondernemende en flexibele mindset: enthousiast om te werken in een zeer dynamische & veranderende omgeving
Resultaatgedreven: in staat om een business initiatief end to end te managen
Vloeiend in Engels en Nederlands
Kennis van Varicent is een plus




Wat we te bieden hebben

Een positie in een innovatieve, gezonde en ambitieuze organisatie die data centraal wil stellen in haar organisatie
Een wendbare organisatie die interne mobiliteit en de mogelijkheid om van rol te veranderen stimuleert
De kans om je carri√®re verder te ontwikkelen door opleidingsmogelijkheden, via een uitgebreide opleidingscatalogus en externe platformen zoals Datacamp en Linkedin Learning, on the job learning en mentoring

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ü§ñ The Job

As a Data Analyst within Dataroots, you'll be a key player in a team bridging the gap between business and data teams. Under the guidance of experienced data consultants, you'll display your passion for translating business needs into tangible data and AI-driven solutions. You'll gather business requirements from clients, identify and assess the necessary data, and build or collaborate to build and deploy effective data solutions.

Your role will extend beyond technical expertise as you translate complex outcomes into business impact, presenting results to stakeholders in clear and understandable terms. Along the way, you'll contribute to developing the right capabilities and governance structures within organisations, ensuring that data solutions deliver sustainable long-term value.




‚úÖ Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports for data visualization.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies to support strategic decision-making.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across various sources.
Optimize data processes and workflows for efficiency and scalability.
Support data-driven decision-making by providing actionable recommendations.
Work with cross-functional teams to integrate data insights into business processes.
Stay updated on industry trends, tools, and best practices in data analytics.




üéâ What you can expect at Dataroots?

Dataroots, a vibrant and dynamic data consulting company founded in 2016, stands out with its unique expertise in the data realm. We are committed to nurturing a culture that prioritises team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing, and outstanding customer experiences, which has fueled our sustained and robust growth. As a Data Analyst at Dataroots, you'll be an essential part of our mission, playing a key role in developing and implementing data-driven solutions for our clients.




Job requirements




üîé The profile

You have at least 2 years experience.
You have worked on a data visualisation project in a professional setting.
You are excited about the potential of data, AI, and digital to solve real-world problems.
You have either a business degree and a technical affinity or a technical degree and a business affinity.
You are curious and possess a healthy dose of drive and ambition.




üí™ The Skills

You have a good overview of the (big-)data ecosystem and know how different components fit in a data engineering or machine learning solution.
You have experience in working with Power BI in a professional setting.
You have experience with programming languages such as SQL, Python, R and cloud platforms AWS, GCP and Azure.
You understand how to collect and identify business requirements and translate these into functional requirements and acceptance criteria.
You possess both strong technical abilities and soft skills to align technical- and business stakeholders and drive change.
You have a can-do attitude, you take ownership of the project to ensure timely delivery & scalable solution through strong project management capabilities.
You know how to build storylines and translate complex solutions into clear & understandable content and context and you are constantly developing your skills in this area.
You speak fluent English and either Dutch or French.




üí∞ The Offer

An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:
Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card
Hospitalization and group insurance
High-end laptop
Smartphone with subscription
Substantial amount of holidays
Meal vouchers
...
Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you‚Äôll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




üìç Where you‚Äôll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Company: Clear Edge International Search & Selection Ltd
Description:
BI Analyst

Location: Kyiv, Poland, Czechia, Malta, or Armenia | Hybrid Working Available




Join a fast-growing international gaming and entertainment company as a BI Analyst, where data plays a central role in shaping business strategy and performance. With operations in over 120 countries and more than 20 years of industry expertise, this company is on a mission to provide exceptional, secure betting and gaming experiences worldwide.




About the Role

As a BI Analyst, you‚Äôll work closely with stakeholders across the business to turn complex data into clear insights. You‚Äôll be responsible for delivering powerful dashboards, maintaining high-quality datasets, and helping teams make informed decisions through data-driven recommendations.

This is a hybrid role with flexible location options, including Kyiv, Poland, Czechia, Malta, or Armenia.




Key Responsibilities

Analyze large datasets to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement
Build and maintain dashboards and reports using BI tools like Metabase or Tableau
Translate business needs into effective BI solutions through close stakeholder collaboration
Ensure data quality and consistency across systems
Develop and optimize data workflows and integration pipelines
Track and report on KPIs, offering actionable insights to improve business performance
Contribute to broader analytics projects and support senior team members as needed




Requirements

Degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or related field
2+ years of experience in BI, preferably within iGaming, e-commerce, or digital products
Solid SQL skills and experience working with BI tools such as Tableau or Metabase
Strong understanding of online business metrics (web, CRM, product, financial)
Upper-intermediate English proficiency (spoken and written)
Confident communicator, comfortable presenting findings to technical and non-technical audiences
Able to work both independently and collaboratively in cross-functional teams




What We Value

Analytical Thinking: Ability to extract clear insights from complex data
Attention to Detail: High standards for accuracy and reliability
Collaboration: Team-oriented, proactive communicator
Adaptability: Comfortable working in dynamic, fast-moving environments
Business Awareness: Understanding how data connects to strategy
Proactivity: Willing to take initiative and drive improvements




What‚Äôs in It for You

Competitive salary based on experience
Health insurance coverage for you and your family
Upskilling and reskilling programs
Team events and corporate gatherings
4 additional personal days off per year

Title: Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead
Description:
üìÑ Type: Full-time | üìä Experience: Mid-Senior (4-7 years experience)




At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead to bridge the gap between raw data, marketing intelligence, and strategic decision-making. You will be at the heart of our strategic department, ensuring insights drive real marketing and business impact.




Your Mission:

Translate complex data into actionable insights for marketing and business decisions.
Scope and optimize analytics, measurement, and dashboarding projects for top clients.
Work closely with consultants and leadership to define and refine key business KPIs.
Ensure data quality, build meaningful reports, and provide strategic recommendations.
Coach and train teams, fostering a strong data-driven culture at Semetis.




What You Bring:

4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldn‚Äôt be offered.




Why Join Semetis?

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data‚Äîwe turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium‚Äôs leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.




This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn‚Äôt just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.




If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.




Full job description & application details here.




Ready to make an impact? Let‚Äôs talk.

Title: Remote: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.




A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.




Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & Dutch language
Being a resident in Belgium for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Belgium
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




You may also confirm your interest and send your CV directly via email to mailyn.esguerra@telusdigital.com with the subject line: Application for [Job Title] ‚Äì LinkedIn, to ensure your application is promptly received and reviewed.

HTML:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.


A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

  • In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
  • Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.


Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!


No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.


Basic Requirements

  • Full Professional Proficiency in English & Dutch language
  • Being a resident in Belgium for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Belgium
  • Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
  • Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
  • Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software


Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.


You may also confirm your interest and send your CV directly via email to mailyn.esguerra@telusdigital.com with the subject line: Application for [Job Title] ‚Äì LinkedIn, to ensure your application is promptly received and reviewed.

Title: Data Analist II
Description:
The Tribe Daily Banking & Client First, within the Branch Operations & Sales area, is looking for a Data Analyst II. In this role, you will actively contribute to translating our ‚ÄúTogether for Progress‚Äù strategy into actionable insights for Financial Experts‚Äîmarking a new chapter in our strategic journey ‚ÄúBanking Made Simple.‚Äù Driven by your passion for

(i) data & reporting,

(ii) customers, and

(iii) branch & digital banking (‚ÄúMobile First‚Äù),

you will support the successful implementation of our Daily Banking product and customer strategy across both statutory and independent branch networks. You‚Äôll do this through factual reporting, proactive in-depth analysis, and strategic advice.

Do you know how to support and challenge ideas with facts and figures? Do you have an innovative mindset? Do you enjoy analyzing and solving business problems? Then we‚Äôre looking for you!

A Day in the Life of a Data Analyst II

As a Data Analyst II, You Will Focus On


Supporting the implementation of our Daily Banking Mobile Led strategy by building and maintaining insightful reports focused on our Key Performance Indicators using Cognos or other platforms.
Running a daily data process that automatically updates all linked reports.
Modifying or adding new or updated simple and complex metrics to our data package and process, in close collaboration with data stakeholders from other product tribes and/or data management.
Ensuring constant availability of data and performance reports (across all objectives such as sales, service, digitization, customer satisfaction, and lead generation) for daily steering and performance discussions.
Building and managing a backlog in coordination with management, based on both business and data-technical prioritization.
Proactively analyzing direct metrics and, where necessary, linking them with other parameters. You will then inform stakeholders, often Senior Management or Expert Leads.


What Makes You Successful

Together with the team, you take responsibility for maximizing the efficiency and continuous availability of data and performance reports related to all ambitions.


You hold a Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Business Administration, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field‚Äîor have at least 3 years of equivalent experience.
You are fluent in English; Dutch and/or French are a plus.
You perform sharp analyses based on available data.
You have 2‚Äì5 years of demonstrable experience with data analysis using tools such as SQL, SAS, Excel, Cognos, Power BI, or Python.
You know how to translate a business question into analytical questions and provide clear, visually appealing answers.
You are a team player within and beyond your team, with a proactive attitude and a sense of ownership for assigned projects. You are also happy to work 50% of your time at the newly renovated Marnix office in Brussels.


As a Data Analyst II at Daily Banking & Client First, You Will:


Play a crucial role in supporting the successful achievement of our commercial growth


objectives in the statutory branch network.


Develop your expertise in a naturally data-driven and evolving domain.
Grow both your analytical and project management skills.
Collaborate with colleagues from the Tribe Daily Banking & Client First, Data Management, and other product teams.


The Team

The Data Analysts team is responsible for maximizing the impact of the branch network through factual reporting and proactive, in-depth analysis and advice. The team consists of 3 data experts in the roles of data analysts and process managers. They provide Senior Management, Regional and Team Leads, and Financial Experts in our ING branch network with insights to improve daily performance, customer processes, and sales. As part of the Branch Mobile Sales & Business Intelligence domain, the team shares responsibility for strategic development and maximizing customer satisfaction, efficiency, and commercial results at the branch level.

Benefits


Personal growth & challenging work with the space and flexibility to realize your ambitions.
Discovering the branch network, a key success factor in achieving commercial goals and high


customer satisfaction.


An informal and dynamic environment that supports your efforts and values your proactive


initiatives.


A team that prioritizes team spirit, organizing various activities throughout the year.


, ING Bank

Title: Senior Data Analyst

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We are an iGaming company with over three years of experience and a team of more than 1300+ specialists.

Our achievements include 10+ major projects that are popular among our clients and successfully operate in Tier 1-3 countries.

The company attracts and values highly qualified specialists, which allows us to efficiently build processes and successfully expand our presence in new locations.

Join the team that launches new projects in various markets and shapes the future of the iGaming industry.

About the Position:

We are looking for a Data Analyst who can help transform large volumes of performance data into a clear picture of ROI and business growth. You will work as part of the affiliate marketing team, supporting both marketing and product analytics.

Your Responsibilities:

Build dashboards in Power BI to visualize key metrics: LTV, ROMI, RAOS, Retention, Rolling Retention, Payback Time
Conduct cohort analysis of traffic sources, user behavior, and value dynamics
Analyze campaign performance by source, geo, affiliates, and creatives
Create automated reports for affiliate, product, and finance teams
Develop predictive ROI models based on historical data
Support decision-making: justify affiliate payouts and provide budget recommendations

What We Expect from You:

Experience with Power BI (publishing, DAX, drill-downs, KPI visualizations)
Understanding of LTV models (recursive, cohort-based, predictive), ROMI, and retention metrics
Ability to draw insights from data and clearly communicate findings
Experience in iGaming, fintech, affiliate, or mobile marketing is a plus
Proficiency in SQL and Excel/Google Sheets (pivot tables, formulas)

Why you should join us:

We work remotely: Mon-Fri, from 10:00 to 19:00 (UTC+2) ‚Äì save time by avoiding commuting.
Paid vacation and sick leave ‚Äì we care about your health and timely rest. Additionally, you will have a day off in honor of your Birthday.
Competitive salary ‚Äì your contribution will be properly valued.
Participation in company internal events ‚Äì knowledge exchange among colleagues and enhancing your expertise.
Freedom from micromanagement and rigid hierarchies ‚Äì we make decisions quickly, and you can always reach out for advice directly from any team member.
100% guaranteed professional development and acquisition of new skills.
As a team, we are constantly striving to be the best among our competitors! We offer a dynamic, forward-thinking work environment within a profitable company. We recognize that our specialists and managers are crucial to our success and are always ready to support their initiatives.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Jouw functie?

Als data analist geef je data betekenis door ze te analyseren, visualiseren en interpreteren met als doel bedrijfsprocessen slimmer en effici√´nter te maken. Je werkt nauw samen met klanten om hun doelstellingen en verwachtingen scherp te krijgen, zodat je gericht aan de slag kunt met het verzamelen, verwerken en analyseren van gegevens via geavanceerde statistische technieken en tools.




Je rol is veelzijdig en combineert elementen van business support, data science en het toepassen van machine learning en big data oplossingen.




Jouw takenpakket:

Het verzamelen, analyseren en interpreteren van complexe datasets
Het ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen en uitvoeren van scenarioanalyses
Je adviseert klanten over de beste benadering voor hun specifieke uitdaging
Inzichten helder en overtuigend presenteren via rapporten en presentaties
Samenwerken in multidisciplinaire teams om oplossingen te ontwikkelen en te implementeren.
Je blijft hoogte blijven van de laatste trends en innovaties binnen de data science wereld




Wat verwachten we van jou?

Je hebt een diploma en een eerste goede werkervaring.
Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en Engels.
Je hebt sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en werkt graag klantgericht




Over we+

Bij we+ leveren we hoogwaardige IT-consultancydiensten die innovatie en transformatie stimuleren bij onze klanten.

Met expertise in Customer Experience, e-commerceoplossingen, applicatieontwikkeling, project delivery, cloud & infrastructuur en data & innovatie bieden we doeltreffende, persoonlijke oplossingen.

Wij zijn de Plus voor onze klanten.

Title: Data Analyst - Contractor
Description:
GigsRemote connects trusted companies with top tech contractors from Central and Eastern Europe, bringing them together to work on IT projects of varying complexity and duration. Our aim is to create an ongoing opportunity for gig talent allowing them to work from any location and set their own work-life balance focusing on projects they feel passionate about.




For one of our clients, we are looking for a Data Analyst on B2B contract.




Expected project duration: 6+ months

Special requirement: candidates must be be based in and have citizenship of European Union




Must have requirements:

Minimum 3 years of experience in Data Analyst role
Strong experience with Python and SQL
Excellent client-facing skills
German language at least on the level of B2




Nice-to-have requirements:

Experience with MicroStrategy
Fraud / Investigation experience




If you are interested, apply here or sign-up on our website. If we find your application matching the listed requirements, our Talent Advisor will get in touch with you to discuss further process.

Title: Amazon Business Intelligence Data Analyst [363]
Description:
About the Company:

The CGK Linens is a fast-growing e-commerce company selling across Amazon and other platforms. They thrive in a fast-paced, results-driven environment where data is at the heart of their decision-making. As they scale, they‚Äôre looking for a sharp and proactive BI Data Analyst to lead their data operations and elevate their business intelligence capabilities.




About the Role:

We are seeking a highly analytical and communicative Amazon BI Data Analyst with hands-on experience working with Amazon Seller Central data. You will play a critical role in shaping the company‚Äôs data strategy and reporting infrastructure. This is a high-impact role where you‚Äôll bridge technical and non-technical teams, ensuring data is clean, accurate, and actionable.

This is a Full-Time remote role.




We are looking for an Amazon BI Data Analyst specifically with these requirements:

3+ years of experience in a BI/Data Analyst or similar role
Experience with Amazon Seller Central data is a strong plus
Proficiency in SQL, Google Sheets/Excel, and data visualization tools (Power BI or Tableau)
Experience working with APIs, ETL pipelines, and data integration tools
Excellent communication skills ‚Äì able to explain complex data to non-technical stakeholders
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
Highly organized with strong attention to detail




Your responsibility will include (but not limited to):

Owning and managing the company‚Äôs end-to-end data analytics efforts
Cleaning, structuring, and maintaining data from Amazon and other platforms
Building dashboards and creating insightful visualizations in Tableau or Power BI
Translating business needs into technical requirements and data-driven solutions
Collaborating with cross-functional teams ‚Äì including marketing, operations, and finance
Ensuring data accuracy and consistency across reporting
Identifying trends and patterns to uncover growth opportunities
Proactively recommending actionable insights that drive results




Growth Opportunities/Perks:

Location-independent role ‚Äì work from anywhere
Be part of a company that values autonomy, ownership, and results
Opportunity to shape and lead the BI strategy in a fast-growing company
Work alongside a strategic, cross-functional team




This Position Is Perfect For You If‚Ä¶




You thrive on structuring and analyzing data.

You enjoy working with complex datasets, especially from platforms like Amazon Seller Central, and take pride in cleaning, organizing, and transforming raw data into meaningful insights.




You're a visual storyteller.

You‚Äôre skilled at building clear, actionable dashboards using tools like Power BI or Tableau, helping teams make informed decisions at a glance.




You‚Äôre proactive and detail-oriented.

You take ownership of your work, double-check your outputs, and are always thinking ahead, identifying opportunities, fixing data gaps, and suggesting better ways to report.







Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.




Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Senior Data BI Analyst

Location: Remote

Type: B2B Contract




Job Description:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or a related field.
Proven experience working with Power BI in a business intelligence or data analytics role.

Strong experience with DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and SQL
Strong understanding of Project Portfolio Management (PPM) principles and practices.

  • Strong organizational skills and experience prioritizing competing requirements and managing stakeholder expectations.
  • Driver mentality to help get things done
  • Advanced English Expression and the ability to convey ideas clearly and effectively

Title: Data Analyst senior
Description:
Senior Data Analyst - Strategic Role in Financial Services

We're partnering with a major player in the financial services sector to find a Senior Data Analyst ready to make a real impact. If you're passionate about turning complex data into clear, actionable insights and influencing key business decisions, this role is for you.

What You'll Do

As part of an agile, cross-functional team, you'll help shape the company's data strategy by:


Partnering with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into analytical approaches
Conducting deep dives into customer behavior and delivering predictive models
Building automated dashboards and generating advanced reports using SQL, Adobe Analytics, Cognos, or SAS
Presenting insights through compelling data storytelling adapted to both technical and non-technical audiences
Ensuring your work respects data privacy and compliance standards


What We're Looking For


3+ years of experience in data analytics, ideally in insurance or financial services
Proven expertise in SQL (must-have) and experience with tools like Cognos, Adobe Analytics, or SAS
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proactive and strategic mindset
Ability to simplify complex data into clear business recommendations
Master's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science or similar
Fluent in English (spoken and written)


Why Join


Work on strategic, high-visibility projects that influence business decisions
Join a collaborative environment where innovation and ownership are encouraged
Grow your expertise in a data-mature and people-driven organization
Enjoy flexibility, autonomy, and ongoing opportunities for development


Apply Now

Title: Power BI Consultant
Description:
At Infocura, we are data experts on a mission to help organizations fully harness the power of their data. From our roots in database management to our evolving focus on data governance and architecture, we‚Äôve built a reputation for delivering solutions tailored to each client‚Äôs unique needs. As a family-owned business, we value collaboration and personal growth, fostering a close-knit environment where everyone‚Äôs contributions truly matter. Our main office is located in Holsbeek, and we work with clients all over Belgium.




Your role

We‚Äôre looking for a Power BI Consultant to support a client in the Brussels area. In this role, you will design and build compelling dashboards and reports that bring insights to life. You‚Äôll work in a hybrid environment with both business and technical teams to deliver sustainable BI solutions that drive value.




Your responsibilities

Design interactive Power BI dashboards tailored to business needs
Translate complex data into clear visuals and insights
Integrate diverse data sources to create unified reporting views
Ensure performance optimization and data reliability
Collaborate across teams to ensure alignment on data and reporting requirements




Your expertise

Strong Power BI experience (5+ years developing dashboards and reports)
Fluent in DAX, M & SQL for data transformation and calculations
Analytical mindset with a sharp eye for clean, intuitive visualizations
Effective communicator with both technical and business teams
Proficiency in English and Dutch or French




Why Infocura?

Family Feel: We organize at least four team events each year, plus an annual weekend getaway where partners are welcome.
Flexible & Hybrid Work: While some client-facing time may be required, we promote a healthy mix of remote and on-site collaboration.
Impactful Projects: Contribute to data initiatives for reputable clients where your expertise drives tangible results.
Competitive Package: Enjoy market-aligned compensation, plus opportunities for professional development.




What sets us apart?

Infocura is more than a workplace, it‚Äôs a community of seasoned data experts known for solving the toughest challenges. With a strong foundation in data management and deep technical expertise, we help organizations design, integrate, and optimize their data ecosystems. Our work spans everything from database management to advanced data architecture and governance, ensuring clients get the right solutions for their needs.




If you're looking to work alongside top experts and make a real impact, Infocura is the place to be.




Ready to join us?

Excited to turn data into decisions with powerful dashboards? Apply via LinkedIn or send your CV to jens.miseur@infocura.be.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
For one of my customer we are looking for a Data Analyst with experience in Qlik.

Duration: 6+ months(renewable)

Location: 100% remote

Description:

We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst with strong experience in reporting tools, particularly Qlik, and a background in Commercial & Financial data. The ideal candidate will be adept at working with Google Sheets, have a solid understanding of SQL and databases, and be comfortable documenting IT tools and working with ticketing systems in an agile environment.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain reports using Qlik and other reporting tools.
Analyze Commercial & Financial data to support business decisions.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define business requirements and translate them into actionable insights.
Work with Google Sheets to create dynamic reports and dashboards.
Document IT tools and processes to ensure clarity and consistency.
Support data validation and ensure data integrity across reports.
Assist in managing and prioritizing requests through a ticketing system.
Work within an agile team to support pricing and commercial initiatives.




Required Qualifications

Proven experience as a Business Analyst in a Commercial or Financial domain.
Strong expertise in Qlik and other reporting tools.
Proficiency in Google Sheets, including advanced formulas and automation.
Good understanding of SQL and databases.
Experience with IT documentation and ticketing tools.
Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and business stakeholders.
Experience working in an agile environment is a plus.

Nice-to-Have

Familiarity with Tableau or other BI tools.
Knowledge of Python or other scripting languages for data automation.
Experience with data visualization best practices.

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
Description:
At Uni Systems, we are working towards turning digital visions into reality. We are continuously growing and we are looking for a Business Intelligence Consultant to join our UniQue team.

What will you be bringing to the team?

Design and maintain Enterprise Data Warehouses (EDW), Data Lakes, and complex Business Intelligence solutions in on-premises, cloud, or hybrid environments.
Develop data architectures including ETL processes, data modelling, data virtualization, physical database design, and performance optimization.
Build reporting applications, including report and dashboard development, validation against source systems, and implementation of data quality and health monitoring processes.
Implement and oversee data quality standards, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and reliability through collaboration with stakeholders.
Create technical documentation, define and execute test programs, and assist with system deployment and configuration.
Participate in meetings and workshops with stakeholders and project teams to gather requirements and ensure alignment.
Deliver demos of reports and dashboards, effectively communicating technical solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Provide knowledge sharing, mentoring, and expertise to internal consultants and team members.
Support the go-live process and ensure smooth transition of validated solutions into production.



Requirements



What do you need to succeed in this position?

Bachelor Degree with minimum 9 years of general IT experience (or Master Degree with minimum 5 years of experience).
Strong expertise in data warehouse design and architecture, including relational database systems and knowledge of non-relational database technologies.
Proficiency in SQL and PL/SQL, with hands-on experience across multiple data platforms.¬†
Excellent knowledge of BI tools, including QlikSense, QlikView, Qlik NPrinting, Qlik Mashup, SAP BO, Microsoft Power BI, and related reporting technologies.
Expert knowledge of ETL and data integration tools, such as Oracle Warehouse Builder, Microsoft SQL Server, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), and Microsoft Master Data Services.
Strong command of data modelling and metadata tools, along with experience in OLAP and data mining solutions.
Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms, including Snowflake on Azure, and near real-time data warehousing or change data capture technologies.
Solid understanding of software development methodologies, including RUP, Agile, and experience applying the SAFe methodology.
Domain knowledge in business areas, specifically in eProcurement, finance, and accounting.
Good knowledge of written and spoken English is required (B2 level).



At Uni Systems, we are providing equal employment opportunities and banning any form of discrimination on grounds of gender, religion, race, color, nationality, disability, social class, political beliefs, age, marital status, sexual orientation or any other characteristics. Take a look at¬†¬†for more information.

Title: Data Analyst-Developer
Description:
Within our department IT Front & Packages with the mission of developing and maintaining our web applications and all our third-party applications, we are seeking a Data Analyst-Developer. The person will play a central role in developing IT Data & BI solutions to reach business objectives. She/He will ensure the availability, performance, and evolution of key business applications that support operational and strategic needs. She/He will strive to maximize the use of the company‚Äôs data assets.

The team consists of 8 colleagues who are eager to welcome you!

Your responsibilities

As An Analyst-Developer, Your Key Responsibilities Will Include


Collaborating with stakeholders to understand data needs and translate them into technical specifications.
Designing, developing, and implementing data warehousing and BI solutions to meet business requirements.
Performing data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes using tools such as SQL, Python, and ETL frameworks.
Developing and maintaining dashboards, reports, and visualizations using BI tools like Power BI.
Ensuring data integrity, quality, and security across all data platforms.
Conducting data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions.
Supporting the business in understanding and using the available data to facilitate creation of their own reports and dashboards Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies in data analytics, BI & AI.
Participating in data & BI documentation (implement and manage tools supporting the documentation and contribute to the content along with other team members).
Implementing and managing tools that will improve data security and governance.


Your profile


You hold a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT, Data Science, a related field, or possess equivalent experience.
You have proven experience as a Data Analyst, BI Developer, or similar role.
You have proficiency in SQL, data modeling, and database management.
You have experience with BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
You are familiar with programming languages such as Python.
You are fluent in English and French or Dutch, with a good command of the other national language.
You can learn quickly and adapt in a dynamic environment.
You have an analytical mindset and are solution-oriented.
You are proactive and can communicate effectively with various stakeholders.
You value teamwork and can work both on-site and remotely, including with offshore developers.


Good reasons to join us


A permanent employment contract.
A company that values human scale within a dynamic group where you can make a significant impact.
Accessible management that is close to its employees and fosters a pleasant working environment.
Numerous development opportunities, particularly through our Athora Academy.
A balance between professional and private life with generous holidays (at least 39 days a year), flexible working hours, and up to 3 days of teleworking per week.
An attractive salary package with various fringe benefits.
Modern, bright offices that encourage collaboration.
A central location in the Porte de Namur district, easily accessible by train and public transport, with parking available if needed.
Last but not least‚Ä¶ a sunny terrace, after-work gatherings, team-building activities, an annual staff day, and many other events to discover‚Ä¶ üòâ


If you are looking for a friendly organization with a human touch and value collaboration and mutual support, you have come to the right place!

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Projective Talent | Part of Projective Group
Description:
Ben jij analytisch sterk en gedreven om inzichten uit data te halen die √©cht het verschil maken? Werk je graag met verschillende datasets, tools en stakeholders om waardevolle analyses op te leveren? Dan ben jij misschien de Data Analyst die we zoeken om ons team te versterken!




Onze organisatie investeert volop in data en digitale transformatie. Binnen het Data & IT-team werk je mee aan het ontwikkelen van een betrouwbaar en bruikbaar dataplatform dat inspeelt op zowel operationele als strategische behoeften. We zoeken iemand die niet alleen data begrijpt, maar ook weet hoe je die vertaalt naar bruikbare inzichten voor de business.




Wat ga je doen?




Je analyseert datasets en haalt er trends, verbanden en inzichten uit die bijdragen aan onderbouwde besluitvorming
Je bespreekt vragen en noden met stakeholders en vertaalt die naar gerichte data-analyses en dashboards
Je werkt mee aan het verbeteren van de datakwaliteit en -structuur
Je ondersteunt gebruikers bij het interpreteren van analyses en het inzetten van inzichten in de praktijk
Je denkt actief mee over hoe data slimmer gebruikt kan worden binnen de organisatie




Wat breng jij mee?




We zoeken geen allesweter, maar wel iemand met een nieuwsgierige geest en een sterke interesse in data. Bij ons krijg je ruimte om te groeien, te leren en jezelf verder te ontwikkelen.




Jij beschikt idealiter over:




Een bachelor- of masterdiploma in een analytische richting zoals (Toegepaste) Economie, Informatica, Statistiek, Wiskunde, Engineering of gelijkaardig
Ervaring of interesse in tools zoals SQL, Excel, Power BI, Tableau of Python/R
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om complexe informatie helder over te brengen
Een teamgerichte instelling en de flexibiliteit om samen te werken met verschillende afdelingen
Vlotte kennis van Nederlands of Frans, en een goede beheersing van het Engels




Dit mag je van ons verwachten:




Een aantrekkelijk salaris en een flexibel mobiliteitsbudget (inclusief de keuze voor een bedrijfswagen of fietsleasing). Daarnaast ontvang je ook maaltijd- en ecocheques, een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget √©n verschillende bonussen opportuniteiten - want we vinden dat goed werk beloond mag worden.
Je stapt in een van onze Smart Programmes, afgestemd op waar jij staat in je carri√®re en waar je naartoe wil groeien.
Gebaseerd op jouw skills, ambitie en persoonlijkheid zoeken we samen naar de juiste match bij een van onze klanten.
Tijdens het hele traject word je begeleid door je persoonlijke Talent Development Officer, iemand die er echt is om jou te helpen groeien.
Je staat er nooit alleen voor. Reken op regelmatige training sessies, fun events en een hechte community die altijd achter je staat.
Na twee jaar vol ontwikkeling, coaching en impact krijg je de kans om bij je klant in dienst te treden. Je blijft uiteraard altijd welkom op onze alumni-events.

  • Vlotte kennis van Nederlands of Frans, en een goede beheersing van het Engels


Dit mag je van ons verwachten:


  • Een aantrekkelijk salaris en een flexibel mobiliteitsbudget (inclusief de keuze voor een bedrijfswagen of fietsleasing). Daarnaast ontvang je ook maaltijd- en ecocheques, een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget √©n verschillende bonussen opportuniteiten - want we vinden dat goed werk beloond mag worden.
  • Je stapt in een van onze Smart Programmes, afgestemd op waar jij staat in je carri√®re en waar je naartoe wil groeien.
  • Gebaseerd op jouw skills, ambitie en persoonlijkheid zoeken we samen naar de juiste match bij een van onze klanten.
  • Tijdens het hele traject word je begeleid door je persoonlijke Talent Development Officer, iemand die er echt is om jou te helpen groeien.
  • Je staat er nooit alleen voor. Reken op regelmatige training sessies, fun events en een hechte community die altijd achter je staat.
  • Na twee jaar vol ontwikkeling, coaching en impact krijg je de kans om bij je klant in dienst te treden. Je blijft uiteraard altijd welkom op onze alumni-events.

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
üìä Data Analyst Internship (60%) at Joineer

Location: Z√ºrich (hybrid possible)

Start date: To be agreed

Duration: 3‚Äì6 months

Joineer is an innovative HR tech company specializing in employee surveys and employee experience. Our platform helps organizations continuously gather feedback from their teams ‚Äì in a simple, playful, and impactful way.

To make the value we create for our clients even more tangible, we‚Äôre looking for a data-driven mind to join our team. If you love turning data into value and clear, actionable insights ‚Äì this internship is for you.




üîç Your Mission

Lead a project about how we can use our existing data better to drive more value to customers.

You will:

Analyze survey results, usage patterns, and process data
Extract insights about interaction rates and the impact that is created
Translate data into clear, meaningful success stories for our clients
Collaborate closely with our Customer Success, and Sales teams




üß† What You Bring

You are living near Z√ºrich or you are willing to commute to our office 1-2 days per week.
You‚Äôre studying Data Science, Statistics, Business Informatics, or a related field and have finished your Bachelors degree
You are fluent in English. German is a plus but not necessary.¬†
You have experience with tools like Excel, Python, R, or Mongodb SQL
You think analytically, work independently, and enjoy digging into data
You‚Äôre curious about employee experience, workplace culture, and people analytics
Nice to have: First experience with BI tools like Power BI or Tableau




üöÄ What We Offer

A behind-the-scenes look at a growing HR tech startup with a meaningful mission
Lots of room for initiative, learning, and making a real contribution
A motivated, interdisciplinary team¬†
Flexible working hours and remote-friendly setup
Fair compensation and work with real-world impact




Ready to Join?

We look forward to your application!

Send your CV to jobs@joineer.ch

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
üöÄ We‚Äôre Hiring Internally at TieTalent!




About the Company

TieTalent is the #1 career growth marketplace in Switzerland, France, and Germany, connecting top talent in IT and Digital Marketing with innovative hiring companies. With our unique reverse recruitment model, candidates don‚Äôt need to apply to jobs or write motivation letters ‚Äî companies apply to interview them for relevant roles.




About the Role:

Freelance Data Analyst (Remote) - 1-2 months mission




As a freelance Data Analyst, you will dive deep into our platform data to unlock insights that help us boost engagement, registrations, and monetization. You‚Äôll analyze user behavior, job interactions, traffic sources, and partner job performance ‚Äî then translate this into clear recommendations that impact our growth.




Your Responsibilities:

Analyze user activity across the platform: clicks, impressions, registration patterns, and engagement trends.
Identify high-performing and underperforming job listings based on job type, location, source, etc.
Assess partner job lifecycle metrics to optimize job listings and partner engagement.
Investigate funnel drop-offs (e.g. click-to-register, browse-to-click) and provide strategies to increase conversion rates.
Segment talents based on location, job preferences, and activity for targeted offers.
Understand traffic sources to inform acquisition and retention strategies.
Deliver clear, actionable reports and dashboards to guide decision-making.
Suggest key metrics to monitor post-project for long-term optimization.
Design and implement dashboards for internal stakeholders (Product, Marketing, Ops) to track key KPIs.




Your Profile: (Apply only if you tick all the must-haves!)

‚úÖ Strong experience in data analysis (min 5 years of work experience).

‚úÖ Excellent English level (C1+)

‚úÖ Proven experience in using using SQL, Python, or similar tools.

‚úÖ Strong skills in data visualization (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar).

‚úÖ Have experience working with job platforms** marketplaces, e-commerce or SaaS tools

‚úÖ Analytical mindset with ability to turn data into business recommendations.

‚úÖ Excellent communication skills and ability to work remotely with cross-functional teams.




Interested? Here's How to Apply:

Apply directly via LinkedIn
Create an account at tietalent.com/signup and complete your profile (make sure to indicate interest in this position)
Send a quick email to apply@tietalent.com to highlight your motivation

You‚Äôll analyze user behavior, job interactions, traffic sources, and partner job performance ‚Äî then translate this into clear recommendations that impact our growth.


Your Responsibilities:

  • Analyze user activity across the platform: clicks, impressions, registration patterns, and engagement trends.
  • Identify high-performing and underperforming job listings based on job type, location, source, etc.
  • Assess partner job lifecycle metrics to optimize job listings and partner engagement.
  • Investigate funnel drop-offs (e.g. click-to-register, browse-to-click) and provide strategies to increase conversion rates.
  • Segment talents based on location, job preferences, and activity for targeted offers.
  • Understand traffic sources to inform acquisition and retention strategies.
  • Deliver clear, actionable reports and dashboards to guide decision-making.
  • Suggest key metrics to monitor post-project for long-term optimization.
  • Design and implement dashboards for internal stakeholders (Product, Marketing, Ops) to track key KPIs.


Your Profile: (Apply only if you tick all the must-haves!)

‚úÖ Strong experience in data analysis (min 5 years of work experience).

‚úÖ Excellent English level (C1+)

‚úÖ Proven experience in using using SQL, Python, or similar tools.

‚úÖ Strong skills in data visualization (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar).

‚úÖ Have experience working with job platforms** marketplaces, e-commerce or SaaS tools

‚úÖ Analytical mindset with ability to turn data into business recommendations.

‚úÖ Excellent communication skills and ability to work remotely with cross-functional teams.


Interested? Here's How to Apply:

  1. Apply directly via LinkedIn
  2. Create an account at tietalent.com/signup and complete your profile (make sure to indicate interest in this position)
  3. Send a quick email to apply@tietalent.com to highlight your motivation

Title: Power BI Consultant
Description:
At Synechron, we believe in the power of digital to transform businesses for the better. Our global consulting firm combines creativity and innovative technology to deliver industry-leading digital solutions. Synechron‚Äôs progressive technologies and optimization strategies span end-to-end Consulting, Design, Cloud, Data, and Engineering, servicing an array of noteworthy financial services and technology firms. Through research and development initiatives in our FinLabs we develop solutions for modernization, from Blockchain and Artificial Intelligence to Data Science models, Digital Underwriting, mobile-first applications and more. Over the last 20+ years, our company has been honored with multiple employer awards, recognizing our commitment to our talented teams. With top clients to boast about, Synechron has a global workforce of 14,500+, and has 58 offices in 21 countries within key global markets.



For more information on the company, please visit our website or LinkedIn community.



Why join Synechron ?



We are in constant search for talented and enthusiastic people who are passionate about working with our clients and being the best ambassadors for our company.





Job Description



Your mission :



To reinforce the Synechron Switzerland team, we are looking for a Power BI Consultant. Our mission is for one of our clients, a Private Bank in Geneva.



Your responsibilities :



Collecting and documenting the needs identified from MIS report consumers;
Identifying and communicating to the Data Hub team the data requirements identified for the reports;
Performing data visualization developments (Power BI) for the Wealth Management division;
Monitoring monthly and daily data loading processes to anticipate production incidents;
Ensuring data quality, as well as to promoting high quality service;
Understanding complex management processes and applying efficient solutions;
Providing support for functional, operational and technical system issues;
Training the Wealth Management division on Power BI reporting capabilities.


Qualifications



Your profile and your skills:



You have knowledge of banking, particularly in investment, which is a plus.
You demonstrate very strong analytical skills.
You have experience with Microsoft Power BI and Fabric,
You have good knowledge of Spark.
You possess SQL knowledge and practical experience.
You are a problem solver and team player with great adaptability skills.
You speak English and French.
You are a Swiss resident.


Additional Information



What we offer you:



An enriching, dynamic, and stimulating professional experience.
Professional stability with a long-term contract.
A competitive salary package and referral bonuses.
Monthly support to finance your lunches.
The opportunity to be part of a multicultural, supportive, hardworking team driven by values.
Up to 5 days of training per year.
Free and unlimited access to our global E-learning platform -> Over 16,000 modules available.
Annual license to access our banking/finance profession training platform to enhance your knowledge of various banking/financial professions and stay professionally updated.
Support, proximity, regular feedback, and exceptional event.
A certified working environment - GREAT PLACE TO WORK.

If you believe you are the right candidate, please submit your application! We look forward to receiving your application.



SYNECHRON‚ÄôS DIVERSITY & INCLUSION STATEMENT



Diversity & Inclusion are fundamental to our culture, and Synechron is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. Our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) initiative ‚ÄòSame Difference‚Äô is committed to fostering an inclusive culture ‚Äì promoting equality, diversity and an environment that is respectful to all. We strongly believe that a diverse workforce helps build stronger, successful businesses as a global company. We encourage applicants from across diverse backgrounds, race, ethnicities, religion, age, marital status, gender, sexual orientations, or disabilities to apply. We empower our global workforce by offering flexible workplace arrangements, mentoring, internal mobility, learning and development programs, and more.



All employment decisions at Synechron are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to the applicant‚Äôs gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst ‚Äì BI & Visualization Specialist
Description:
EPAM is looking for a Data Analyst to support the data analytics team of a prestigious client in the luxury sector.

Based in our Geneva office in a hybrid setup, this is your chance to make a meaningful impact in a forward-thinking environment.

Would you like to be a part of this ambitious and innovative project? We look forward to receiving your application.

Responsibilities



Develop data products across one or more business domains, in alignment with team objectives
Continuously enhance these products to ensure a seamless user experience and maintain data accuracy and consistency with source systems
Provide‚ÄØLevel 3 support‚ÄØfor these products
Define and validate data ingestion workflows for the company‚Äôs data warehouse and data lakes, ensuring reliability and alignment with business needs
Drive adoption of self-service BI tools by engaging the user community through effective communication, training sessions and ongoing support
Contribute to the design and upkeep of reporting solutions, with a strong focus on developing impactful data visualizations using Tableau



Requirements



Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience with the Tableau suite, including Desktop, Server and Prep
Demonstrated advanced expertise in Tableau Desktop, particularly in environments integrating SAP BW and Snowflake as data sources
Excellent skills in data visualization, with a keen ability to translate complex data into clear, impactful insights
Strong knowledge of data modeling and data source development within BW data warehouses and/or Snowflake environments
Solid understanding of data processing techniques (extraction, transformation and loading), with hands-on experience using tools like Control-M and Dataiku
Strong interpersonal and time management skills, with the ability to effectively prioritize and deliver enhancements and new data products in a timely manner
Fluent in French



We offer



5 weeks of vacation
EPAM Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
Enhanced parental leave
Extended pension plan
Daily sickness allowance insurance
Employee assistance program
Global business travel medical and accident insurance
Learning and development opportunities including in-house training and coaching, professional certifications, over 22,000 courses on LinkedIn Learning Solutions and much more
*All benefits and perks are subject to certain eligibility requirements
Please note that any offers will be subject to appropriate background checks
We do not accept CVs from recruiting or staffing agencies
For this position, we are able to consider applications from the following:
- Swiss nationals
- EU/EFTA nationals
- Third-country nationals based in Switzerland with an appropriate work permit
- Displaced people from Ukraine who are currently in Switzerland and hold, or have already applied for, S permits

Title: Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team Mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

As a Data Analyst in the Product Analytics team, you will support the Fulfillment mission‚Äîimproving the post-booking experience, empowering suppliers, and enabling Care to resolve issues efficiently. You‚Äôll work across the analytics funnel to drive measurement, strategy, and decision-making. Example problems include quantifying the impact of improved pickup selection on defect rate, identifying drivers of booking issues, or evaluating how post-booking communication affects traveller sentiment and retention.

You will


Design and analyze A/B tests to evaluate product changes and guide decision-making.
Develop quantitative analysis to drive product decisions
Help the product teams to learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams‚Äô product strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product development and evaluation.


Who You Are


2-3 years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity, reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Ability to communicate data insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders, influencing decisions across product, engineering, and operations


Nice to have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus
Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences.
The opportunity to contribute to the
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
GetYourGuide vouchers.


And more‚Ä¶

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Logistics Data Analyst Intern
Description:
CONTEXT

In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.

Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.

Key Responsibilities


Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.

You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.

You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.

You speak English fluently (French is a plus).

You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.

Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment

Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.
