Title: Operations & BI Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Purpose of the position:

Drive operational excellence and commercial performance by integrating data-led insights with a strong business and customer lens. This role will bridge operations, finance, and customer experience to support strategic decision-making.

Job Size

This position has direct impact on the entire KFC Western Europe Business Unit Corporate, Franchisee & Restaurant System and indirect impact, through know how sharing, to the Pan-Europe and global teams.

Job Functions

Customer & Operations Insights (50%)


Analyze core operations and commercial data (e.g., OSAT, sales, transactions, compliance, training, margin drivers) to generate actionable insights.
Conduct competitor benchmarking and market intelligence to identify growth opportunities and risks.
Partner with Finance and Marketing to align operational KPIs with commercial targets and customer value drivers.
Lead post-implementation reviews of commercial and operational initiatives.
Ad-hoc customer analysis ‚Äì understanding what our customers are telling us through surveys, social media and reviews to articulate satisfiers, dissatisfiers and areas of risk through the end-to-end customer & Restaurant Member journeys
Lead unbiased approach to field/operations/technology launch reviews/diagnostics


Data Strategy & Visualization (30%)


Generate regular reports, with a view to streamlining reporting by creating automated dashboards.
Weekly/Monthly/Quarterly performance review; preparation and presentation of regular business update. meetings. Diagnose performance concerns and provide insight-led recommendations.
Build and maintain automated dashboards and reporting tools (e.g., Power BI, DOMO) to track performance and commercial KPIs.
Translate complex data into compelling narratives and visualizations for senior stakeholders.
Collaborate with Technology and Data teams to enhance data infrastructure and accessibility.
Work with Operations to define field data and reporting needs to support Operations Performance


Strategic Projects & Field Enablement (10%)


Support strategic initiatives such as initiative launches, format innovation, and digital transformation.
Develop playbooks and toolkits to scale data best practices across markets.
Enable field teams with insights and tools to drive performance and customer experience.


Communication & Influence (10%)


Support strategic initiatives such as new market entries, format innovation, and digital transformation.
Develop playbooks and toolkits to scale best practices across markets.
Enable field teams with insights and tools to drive performance and customer experience.


Working Relationships


KFC WEBU LT: COO
KFC WEBU Teams: Field Ops, Customer Experience, Marketing, Finance & Technology
KFC Global: Compliance & Customer Teams
KFC Global: Counterparts for know-how sharing


Knowledge And Skills Required


Degree in Analytics, Commercial Finance, Business, or related field
3‚Äì5 years in a commercial, operations, or business intelligence role
Quick learner with strong commercial acumen and understanding of P&L levers
Experience with BI tools (Power BI, DOMO), SQL, and Excel
Proven ability to effectively collaborate across teams
Proven ability to synthesize data into strategic insights
Experience in creating visualizations and presentations that can bring the data story to life
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Experience in QSR, retail, or FMCG preferred
Fluent in English; additional European languages a plus


#PanEurope

About Us

From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. Always original, our passion is high-quality, finger lickin‚Äô good chicken. Yes, we also have a secret recipe. No, we can‚Äôt share it. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.

We‚Äôre part of Yum! Brands, Inc.‚Äîcollaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central & Eastern Europe and France. With more than 30 official languages in 150 different franchises, connecting with us is easier than ever. If you really want to do the math, we‚Äôve also got 2,200 restaurants in 40 countries. Either way, we keep it original.

For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow‚Äôs technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you‚Äôve ever tasted. We exist to feed people‚Äôs potential, valuing personal development and an inclusive culture. This also means having a keen social purpose and investing in mentorship, upskilling and food security. Creating opportunities for the most underserved and vulnerable groups in our communities helps grow new roots and strengthen bonds.

We want our people to be their best selves. So, we invest in skills, resources and each other. At our Pan Europe Academy, we develop leadership and train all levels of restaurant and corporate employees. From Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to Individual Development Plans, we build meaningful careers that have real impact.

The bottom line? We bring it. Curious? We hope so.

Bring your spark, your spice and your original story. At KFC Pan Europe, we‚Äôre grounded in winning, celebrating, recognizing, welcoming and belonging. We've got a big table. You have a seat at it.

Data Strategy & Visualization (30%)

  • Generate regular reports, with a view to streamlining reporting by creating automated dashboards.
  • Weekly/Monthly/Quarterly performance review; preparation and presentation of regular business update. meetings. Diagnose performance concerns and provide insight-led recommendations.
  • Build and maintain automated dashboards and reporting tools (e.g., Power BI, DOMO) to track performance and commercial KPIs.
  • Translate complex data into compelling narratives and visualizations for senior stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with Technology and Data teams to enhance data infrastructure and accessibility.
  • Work with Operations to define field data and reporting needs to support Operations Performance

Strategic Projects & Field Enablement (10%)

  • Support strategic initiatives such as initiative launches, format innovation, and digital transformation.
  • Develop playbooks and toolkits to scale data best practices across markets.
  • Enable field teams with insights and tools to drive performance and customer experience.

Communication & Influence (10%)

  • Support strategic initiatives such as new market entries, format innovation, and digital transformation.
  • Develop playbooks and toolkits to scale best practices across markets.
  • Enable field teams with insights and tools to drive performance and customer experience.

Working Relationships

  • KFC WEBU LT: COO
  • KFC WEBU Teams: Field Ops, Customer Experience, Marketing, Finance & Technology
  • KFC Global: Compliance & Customer Teams
  • KFC Global: Counterparts for know-how sharing

Knowledge And Skills Required

  • Degree in Analytics, Commercial Finance, Business, or related field
  • 3‚Äì5 years in a commercial, operations, or business intelligence role
  • Quick learner with strong commercial acumen and understanding of P&L levers
  • Experience with BI tools (Power BI, DOMO), SQL, and Excel
  • Proven ability to effectively collaborate across teams
  • Proven ability to synthesize data into strategic insights
  • Experience in creating visualizations and presentations that can bring the data story to life
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
  • Experience in QSR, retail, or FMCG preferred
  • Fluent in English; additional European languages a plus

#PanEurope

About Us

From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. Always original, our passion is high-quality, finger lickin‚Äô good chicken. Yes, we also have a secret recipe. No, we can‚Äôt share it. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.

We‚Äôre part of Yum! Brands, Inc.‚Äîcollaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central & Eastern Europe and France. With more than 30 official languages in 150 different franchises, connecting with us is easier than ever. If you really want to do the math, we‚Äôve also got 2,200 restaurants in 40 countries. Either way, we keep it original.

For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow‚Äôs technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you‚Äôve ever tasted. We exist to feed people‚Äôs potential, valuing personal development and an inclusive culture. This also means having a keen social purpose and investing in mentorship, upskilling and food security. Creating opportunities for the most underserved and vulnerable groups in our communities helps grow new roots and strengthen bonds.

We want our people to be their best selves. So, we invest in skills, resources and each other. At our Pan Europe Academy, we develop leadership and train all levels of restaurant and corporate employees. From Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to Individual Development Plans, we build meaningful careers that have real impact.

The bottom line? We bring it. Curious? We hope so.

Bring your spark, your spice and your original story. At KFC Pan Europe, we‚Äôre grounded in winning, celebrating, recognizing, welcoming and belonging. We've got a big table. You have a seat at it.

Title: Junior Power Analyst
Description:
Junior Power Analyst




Due to our continuing expansion, an exciting position has opened up in our Power Trading Team for a Junior Power Analyst. This role will offer the opportunity to work, learn, and grow alongside experienced professional traders and analysts, directly contributing to the Team‚Äôs success on the markets.




The successful candidate will work on developing European Power Markets models, simulating supply and demand scenarios and contributing to trading strategies. A strong business acumen is required, as is a passion for quantitative development, given the necessity for continuous interaction with Traders, Meteorologists, Analysts and IT developers.







Requirements:




Ideally you will have 1/2 years of experience in an analytical environment with a degree in Engineering, Computer Science or Quantitative Economics/Finance with solid academic training. Strong data analysis and coding skills (Python, SQL) are a must. You will be fluent in English and a second European language will be considered a plus. Although not absolutely necessary, experience in the power market analysis or energy fields would be advantageous.




Offer:




DXT offers a full-time permanent position with a competitive remuneration package. Help with relocation, if necessary, is also provided. On the job training will be given by seasoned professionals directly on the trading desk. The successful candidate will also receive DXT‚Äôs benefits and well-being package and will be supported by the Duferco Academy for growth and development.







Please send your updated CV together with a cover letter to: hr.power.analyst@dxt.com

Title: Business Intelligence and Data Analyst Executive
Description:
Job description:

The Opportunity

We are looking for a Business Intelligence and Data Analyst Executive to join our EMAD Commercial team (European, Mediterranean, and African Distributors). In this role, you will be an integral part of our team, contributing to the company‚Äôs growth objectives and strategies. You will provide operational support to the Business Intelligence Manager for Data Management, analysis and reporting.

¬†

Geographical scope: Europe non-affiliate countries (Nordics, Baltics, Central, Eastern and South Europe, Turkey, and Israel).

¬†

What you'll get to do
Consolidate sales data, prepare reports (transform raw data into comprehensive reports), analyze business data, identify and share trends:
Niche Sales data optimization and management, reporting and analysis (external and internal stakeholders).
Management of data management company for the whole region that consolidates sales data (external stakeholder).
Analysis of Data deviation of brands/countries/retailers.
Checking the consistency of the sales report received from retailers/distributors.
Assist on Power BI project aimed at automating data visualization.
We'd love to meet you if you have

Experience: 1-2 years of professional working experience as Business Analyst, Data Analytics and Data Management within a business environment. Interest in the luxury and/or beauty industry will be highly valued.

Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Economics or equivalent.

Languages: Fluent in English, any other European language is a plus.

¬†

Competencies:

Curious, proactive, autonomous, and enthusiastic learner with strong communication skills.
Analytical mindset with focus on attention to details.
Flexibility and ability to handle multi-tasks and interact cross-departments.
Highly organized and detail oriented.
Digital Savvy.
Team player with strong service orientation and emotional resilience.

Specific Knowledge required: Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and ideally Power BI knowledge is a must.

¬†

Contract duration: 6 months.

Start date: ASAP.

¬†

A few things you'll love about us
An entrepreneurial, creative and welcoming work culture
A range of learning and development opportunities
An international company with plenty of opportunities to grow

Title: Junior Data Analyst ‚Äì International Banking
Description:
Job Description

Junior Data Analyst ‚Äì International Banking

____________________________________________________________

Location: Zurich, Switzerland

Type: Full-time

Vertical: Financial Markets

_______________________________________________________________________

Summary

Embark on an exciting journey with us at eClerx Switzerland AG, where you‚Äôll take centre stage as a within eClerx‚Äôs growing global delivery organization. Your mission? Help deliver analytics and actionable insights for one of our long term, financial services, clients here in Switzerland.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and contractual data
Collaborate with colleagues to build data-driven models, reporting and actionable insights
Present findings in a clear, concise manner for internal consumption
Oversee and track the implementation of actionable insights within a PMO framework


Ideal Experience


1+ years of experience in data analytics or data science
Proficiency in programming (Python, SQL)
Experience in Financial Services and financial instruments
Experience in CRM, financial instruments or contract datasets.
Ability to work with structured and unstructured data.
Familiarity with cloud services.


Bonus Points


Experience using LLMs for data summarization, document intelligence, or research enhancement.
Familiarity with vector databases and embedding techniques.


Soft Skills


Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work in a demanding, fast-paced environment while maintaining accuracy.
Excellent communication and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion.


CH Work Permit


MUST have a valid Swiss working permit or carry an EU national passport
CH/EU status must be declared on your CV, otherwise your application will be automatically rejected.


About EClerx

eClerx provides business process management, analytics, and automation services to a number of Fortune 2000 enterprises, including some of the world's leading companies across financial services, cable & telecom, retail, fashion, media & entertainment, manufacturing, travel & leisure, software and high-tech. Incorporated in 2000, eClerx is one of India's leading process management and data analytics companies and is today traded on both the Bombay and National Stock Exchanges of India. eClerx employs 17,000+ people across its global sites in the US, Canada, UK, Australia, Italy, Germany, Switzerland, Dubai and Singapore, along with its delivery centers in India and Thailand. For more information, visit www.eclerx.com

eClerx is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. We are also committed to protecting and safeguarding your personal data. Please find our policy here

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you have an interest in digital marketing and want to work in an environment that is obsessed with adding value to its customer and employees? Do you want to be part of a global mission to revolutionize shopping online? Are you a dynamic and passionate data analytics enthusiast? If so, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

We have a great opportunity for you to join our team as Data Analyst. You will become an integral member of a multicultural team, reporting to Senior Data Analyst and working alongside other like-minded people .

You should be able to communicate well at all levels and excel in a fast-paced and fun environment. We are looking for someone spirited and willing to help others when the need arises, as well as show initiative and enthusiasm for our growing Global Business.

Responsibilities



Developing and upholding reporting to monitor the business activity
Producing analysis that deliver actionable insights, using data correctly, accurately and effectively
Supporting the commercial program around CRM: targeting, tests, selections‚Ä¶
Defining KPIs, interpreting key knowledge derived from studies and communicating them to relevant stakeholders (Marketing, Finance, Contact Center)
Work closely with the Business teams , on improving customer data collection, identifying new opportunities and promote data initiatives
Share best practices and developments between brands and countries Requirements Education



Qualifications



3+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Science, Marketing eCommerce
Ideally experience working in eCommerce environment



Language



Fluent in English, French is a plus



Desired Skills / Additional Requirements



Strong quantitative and analytical capabilities.
Very good knowledge in SQL and EXCEL (VBA would be an asset)
Experience with SAS, R, Python is a plus
Experience with different data mining and forecasting software is a plus
Experience with BI and visualization tools : Power BI , Tableau, QuickSight
Experience with Google analytics
Understanding of digital marketing techniques, technology and marketing campaign strategies
solution driven mindset,
collaborative and supportive team player



T o keep you entertained we offer:



A dynamic, multicultural, and stimulating environment.
A team close to each other with a great collaboration spirit.
A great and friendly work atmosphere.
An office that is 3 min far from Nyon train station and city center.
Flexible working hours and remote work (for cross border workers remote work is subject to restriction by the Swiss authorities).
Some great benefits (such as wellness bonus, contribution to sickness insurance, lunch card, non professional accident insurance paid by employer, breakfast, free coffee and beverage, parties for staff, etc‚Ä¶).

Title: CDD - International Client Data Analyst
Description:
This position is embedded within the dynamic Client Marketing team, which is built on four key pillars: Client Relations, Client Services, Client Insights, and Client Marketing Data & Knowledge.

Empowering Client Knowledge

As an International Client Data Analyst, you'll be part of the Client Marketing Data & Knowledge team, reporting to the Head of International Client Data Science and Analytics. This position offers a unique opportunity to contribute to the Maison's Client Knowledge strategy with the roll-out of the Client Advanced segmentation. You will collaborate with very diverse teams (Product Marketing, Client Marketing centrally and regionally, Group Technology, Cartier Data Office‚Ä¶) to create synergies; leveraging both your business and technical skills.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

Be the Customer Knowledge Business Insight Owner


Enrich & maintain our Client Analytics Platform for Customer Knowledge (data related to transaction and clients, including purchase patterns).
Define enhancement roadmap: Liaise with our region champion and our central users to gather the needs, refine and prioritize the enhancement roadmap of the Customer knowledge data in our Analytics Platform.
Test and document: Test new enhancements and document them to ensure good understanding of our 800+ active users.
Share Knowledge: Train and support users on the reports, empower them to extract valuable insights and leverage the data effectively. Enable community sharing on best practices analysis.


Roll-out our Client Advanced segmentation


Project Management: Lead the organization of the transversal organization of the project from kick-off to launch; liaising with the regions and the central teams.
Define the Advanced segmentation: In close collaboration with the Client Data scientist and the region, define the different segments in alignment with the regional business priorities.
Champion adoption: Accompany regional team in building and enforcing their adoption plan, ensuring transversal usage of the client advanced segmentation.
Facilitate best practice sharing: Leveraging examples from launched regions, foster sharing and highlight best practices.


Search for strategic insight on our Clients‚Äô behavior to drive decision


Answer Business Questions: Deep-dive in the Client Marketing data to conduct analysis and extract strategic insights to answer our business stakeholders and drive Customer insights based on our 1st party data.
Master presentation: Deliver impactful and actionable learnings by adapting presentation to audience.
Diffuse Client Knowledge: Identify key audiences and share the insight and the methodology to autonomize our community.


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?


Academic Background: You have 5+ years of experience in Computer Sciences, Computer Engineering or from a generalist Engineering/Business school with a specialization in data.
Analytical Mindset: You possess a strong analytical mindset, problem-solving skills, and a creative approach to data analysis.
Technical Proficiency: You have proven experience with SQL and ideally some knowledge of a data visualization tool (Looker would be highly appreciated, Power BI is a plus).
Organizational and Project management Skills: You are organized, detail-oriented, and adept at prioritizing tasks effectively. You know how to lead a project from kick-off to closure; working in a highly transversal and collaborative context.
Communication & Collaboration: You excel at communication, collaboration, and organization, with the ability to interact effectively with diverse teams.
Language Fluency: You are fluent in both French and English, both written and spoken.
Office Suite Proficiency: You are comfortable working with the Microsoft Office suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, etc.)

Title: FINANCE DATA ANALYST
Description:
BACKGROUND

As a key member of the Finance Digital Transformation team within our entity, you will be directly responsible for the hands-on development and implementation of digital solutions. Your role will involve actively building and deploying tools that drive transformation and continuous improvement by leveraging financial data.

You will translate business requirements into technical designs and develop robust digital solutions from conception to deployment. This role offers the opportunity to collaborate closely with management and various finance business departments throughout the development process.

How will you make an impact?

Responsibilities

Reporting to the Finance Data Manager and based in Villars-sur-G√¢ne, this role will be responsible for the following responsibilities, including but not limited to:


Gather requirements and identify business intelligence and automation opportunities in Accounts Payable, Treasury, Financial Planning and Internal Controls
Develop, optimize, and maintain existing solutions (BI or Automation), ensuring seamless integration with the company's environment and compliance requirements
Create comprehensive documentation to support and maintain business processes and data analysis/automation efforts
Translate complex data insights into actionable solutions
Leverage and implement the latest available technologies and tools in close collaboration with Group Finance, Group Data Office, and Group Technology


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

Education, Experience And Core Competencies


University degree in Finance, Data science, Mathematics or similar
2 to 4 years‚Äô experience as a Data/Business Analyst or similar role, ideally gained in an international and matrix environment
Strong track record of successfully driving end-to-end projects with concrete business outcomes through data analysis and automation
Professional experience with data visualization software such as PowerBI, SAP Analytics Cloud and/or Looker
Hands on experience with data modelling and data transformation/cleaning (SQL, PowerQuery) and programming languages/algorithms
Hands on experience with automation tools such as Power Automate and/or UiPath
Previous experience with data management in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and/or Microsoft SQL Server is a strong asset
Experience in finance within industrial sector is a plus


Personal, Methodological And Social Skills


High ability to collect, organize and analyze high volume of complex data
Pragmatic and solution-oriented with ability to quickly evaluate, learn, put to use and integrate new technologies
Excellent communication skills
Team player with ability to interact with a variety of professionals at every level of the organization
Ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner
Agile with ability to work in a complex, fast paced and demanding environment


WHAT MAKES OUR GROUP DIFFERENT?

Our true power does not lie in our similarities but in the rich diversity of our arts, cultures, and human skills, as well as our specific ability to foster untapped potential.


We value freedom, collegiality, loyalty, and solidarity.
We foster empathy, curiosity, courage, humility, and integrity.
We care for the world we live in.


YOUR JOURNEY WITH US

Your application will be carefully reviewed by our recruitment teams, who will give you a follow-up shortly. If your profile is selected, we will contact you for an initial phone interview. The next step will be an interview with the Managers and our HR Business Partner.

Title: Digital Analytics Consultant - Geneva (H/F)
Description:
fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands transform with data and AI to improve their marketing operations through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.

As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +320 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.

Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York. fifty-five attaches particular importance to the well-being of its employees, which enabled it to be included in the Best Workplaces France ranking in 2018.

Within the consulting team based in Geneva, you will actively take part in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple clients. Those projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation, media-mix optimisation and digital business consulting. During these projects, you will contribute to promoting a customer-centred vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions. You will work across multiple industries including luxury, FMCG, sport, and beauty.

You will report to a Local Executive Director and will work closely with Product, Engineering and Operations Teams based in Paris. As a data analyst and consultant, you will follow an action plan, issuing step-by-step the deliverables required for successful delivery of the project. You will guarantee the integrity of analytics data as well as its analysis and interpretation in working with your team and client.

You will be responsible for the content, the format and overall quality of the outputs delivered to the client and for monitoring their operational and technical implementation where required. Based on your good understanding of our projects and our clients' needs, you will collaborate with all our teams to develop fifty-five's offer, both in terms of marketing and in terms of technical and operational delivery.

Responsibilities


Deliver projects related to the monitoring of the client's digital activity based on key performance indicators (reporting), to onsite conversion optimization through data analysis and webtesting, to online media buy optimization and CRM
Analyse data and structure relevant information for the client's benefit, in consistency with business indicators specific to their industry (eg. mobile operators, retail, travel, etc.)
Develop a sharp operational expertise on both conversion and online media-buy topics
Meet clients' needs and pay strong attention to the quality of all deliverables
Occasional travel possible, within Switzerland or abroad (including Paris)


Education And Experience


Master's degree (business, engineering) or equivalent diploma
Experience in digital marketing, consulting firms, marketing or business intelligence software, or media agencies
Working with web analytics tools
Knowledge of the main online acquisition channels: SEO, SEM and bidmanagement, display and programmatic, affiliates, email and social media


Skills And Interests


Fluent in French & English and excellent communication, oral and written
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of analysis, statistical software and data vizualization tool
Good business and market understanding
Client-facing skills
Good team spirit
Strong interest in new technologies and the digital industry


55 provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion.

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Swissblock Technologies

Swissblock Technologies is a private investment firm dedicated to pioneering cryptocurrency integration with cross-asset investing. Applying a quantitative view to financial markets, we manage systematic multi-strategy portfolios of digital and traditional assets.




Our Systematic Crypto Group transforms market insights into robust algorithmic investment strategies, trading fully automated on our prop trading infrastructure. We are dedicated to a collaborative, non-siloed environment with shared incentives, where each member can directly shape the team‚Äôs and company's future.




This role can based from anywhere in Switzerland.




Responsibilities and Objectives

Quantitative Researchers in our Systematic Crypto Group have the opportunity to drive the research process from ideation to final implementation, ultimately specialising according to individual strengths and preferences. This will involve to

Analyse the crypto ecosystems to uncover the fundamental dynamics that drive price and risk formation.
Utilise advanced statistical techniques on both traditional and crypto-specific data sets.
Conceptualised and enhanced monetisation systems for trading signals and other market anomalies.
Implement, backtest, and deploy algorithmic trading strategies within a live trading environment.
Monitor live strategy performance and integrate insights into the research loop.
Participate in the development of our research agenda based on research findings and ideas.




Skills and Talents

Advanced degree in a highly quantitative field.
Excellent analytical skills with strong attention to detail; ability to maintain a pragmatic mindset.
Passion for traditional and crypto markets; driven to model the underlying market dynamics.
Ability to conduct data-driven research focused on solving real-world problems.
Dedication to continuous learning and making an impact; willingness to question the status quo.
Ability to effectively summarise and clearly communicate research results.
Prior exposure to quantitative research (preferably in digital assets).
Proficiency in Python and experience in using statistical packages.




Culture

Swissblock Technologies offers an exciting and diverse environment with flat hierarchies and excellent peers. We are a profitable company with a culture based on responsibility and merit. Empowerment of each individual team member is a key value reflected in our career dynamics, which continuously grow with the business.




In addition to a modern office in Baar, Switzerland ‚Äì flexibility to work remotely within Switzerland ‚Äì we propose a competitive compensation package, an annual bonus, 25 days of annual leave, progressive social benefits, and engaging company events.

Show more
HTML:
Swissblock Technologies

Swissblock Technologies is a private investment firm dedicated to pioneering cryptocurrency integration with cross-asset investing. Applying a quantitative view to financial markets, we manage systematic multi-strategy portfolios of digital and traditional assets.


Our Systematic Crypto Group transforms market insights into robust algorithmic investment strategies, trading fully automated on our prop trading infrastructure. We are dedicated to a collaborative, non-siloed environment with shared incentives, where each member can directly shape the team‚Äôs and company's future.


This role can based from anywhere in Switzerland.


Responsibilities and Objectives

Quantitative Researchers in our Systematic Crypto Group have the opportunity to drive the research process from ideation to final implementation, ultimately specialising according to individual strengths and preferences. This will involve to

  • Analyse the crypto ecosystems to uncover the fundamental dynamics that drive price and risk formation.
  • Utilise advanced statistical techniques on both traditional and crypto-specific data sets.
  • Conceptualised and enhanced monetisation systems for trading signals and other market anomalies.
  • Implement, backtest, and deploy algorithmic trading strategies within a live trading environment.
  • Monitor live strategy performance and integrate insights into the research loop.
  • Participate in the development of our research agenda based on research findings and ideas.


Skills and Talents

  • Advanced degree in a highly quantitative field.
  • Excellent analytical skills with strong attention to detail; ability to maintain a pragmatic mindset.
  • Passion for traditional and crypto markets; driven to model the underlying market dynamics.
  • Ability to conduct data-driven research focused on solving real-world problems.
  • Dedication to continuous learning and making an impact; willingness to question the status quo.
  • Ability to effectively summarise and clearly communicate research results.
  • Prior exposure to quantitative research (preferably in digital assets).
  • Proficiency in Python and experience in using statistical packages.


Culture

Swissblock Technologies offers an exciting and diverse environment with flat hierarchies and excellent peers. We are a profitable company with a culture based on responsibility and merit. Empowerment of each individual team member is a key value reflected in our career dynamics, which continuously grow with the business.


In addition to a modern office in Baar, Switzerland ‚Äì flexibility to work remotely within Switzerland ‚Äì we propose a competitive compensation package, an annual bonus, 25 days of annual leave, progressive social benefits, and engaging company events.

Title: Operations Analyst ‚Äì Data Analyst
Description:
Operations Analyst- Data Analyst

Full time office role (no remote, no home office)

Zurich, Switzerland

12 months contract

Your role

Are you an analytic thinker? Do you like to leverage data and analytics to create actionable insights that enhance client experience and support business steering and growth?

We‚Äôre Looking For a Data Analyst To


establish relationships with stakeholders to understand the specific operational and analytical needs of the organization
provide advice on advanced analytical approaches for addressing these needs, and identify and capture the required data sources
derive and implement an outcome-driven analytics approach that meets the operational and analytical needs of the organization
design, implement and maintain reporting based on the organizational needs
leverage statistical, and visualization tools and apply advanced analytical methods such as artificial intelligence
proactively identify opportunities to leverage data to devise and implement data-driven business solutions


Your expertise


University degree or equivalent focusing on Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field
ideally several years working as data specialist or similar within the finance sector
strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work with large datasets
knowledge of statistical tools, visualization tools such as Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Power BI
strong attention to detail and ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
strong active listening and communication skills to build networks and partnerships at all levels
ability to work independently while being a team player
taking ownership to drive topics forward, and demonstrating strong motivation
fluent in English

Your role

Are you an analytic thinker? Do you like to leverage data and analytics to create actionable insights that enhance client experience and support business steering and growth?

  • taking ownership to drive topics forward, and demonstrating strong motivation
  • fluent in English

Title: Merchandising Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Kontoor Brands, Inc. (KTB) is the parent company of Wrangler¬Æ, Lee¬Æ and Rock & Republic¬Æ, with owned manufacturing facilities in Mexico. Kontoor also owns and operates over 140 retail stores across the globe. Our global company employs more than 13,000 people in 65 countries, with world headquarters in Greensboro, North Carolina, and regional headquarters in Geneva and Hong Kong.

Job Posting

Merchandising Data Analyst

Location: Geneva // Switzerland

Join Kontoor Brands, home to iconic denim brands Wrangler¬Æ and Lee¬Æ. We design high-quality apparel that empowers self-expression. Be part of our global community of 17,000+ employees, fostering collaboration and innovation. Grow with us in our Geneva office and shape the future!

What‚Äôs the scope?

Reporting into the EMEA Merchandising Director, the Merchandising Data Analyst collects, processes, analyzes and interprets retail, wholesale and product data to support Merchandising decisions. The Analyst works closely with Merchandising and Planning Team to optimize product assortment, pricing strategies and buying decisions. The key responsibilities include generating reports, identifying trends and providing actionable insights.

Your Responsibilities As Our Merchandising Data Analyst


Collect data from multiple sources and combine it into consolidated reports that are easy to analyze.
Design and generate reports related to sell-through, total business performance, bestsellers, regional performance, and market trends.
Highlight any significant changes or deviations in performance and interpret potential impacts on product and retail strategy.
Work closely with product, retail, and merchandising teams to understand data needs, share insights, and provide recommendations for future strategies.
Track key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure merchandising and product strategies are on track.
Provide additional analysis and custom reports as requested by senior leadership or specific teams to help with decision-making.


Skills For Success


A Bachelor‚Äôs degree and 3‚Äì5 years of experience in retail or merchandising analytics.
A strong understanding of product performance, retail dynamics, and merchandising strategy.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office, with solid experience in SQL, Power BI, or similar data tools.
Fluency in English, both written and verbal; additional European languages are a plus.
Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving ability, and a sharp eye for detail.
A collaborative mindset and the ability to communicate insights clearly and effectively.


We Offer

We value trust, transparency, collaboration, and innovation, and focus on sustainability and teamwork. Our purpose, mission, and values guide us towards continuous growth and leveraging cutting-edge sustainable technologies.

Benefits And Perks Include


Competitive salary package
Discounts on Wrangler¬Æ & Lee¬Æ brands
Casual denim dress code at work and beyond
A multicultural, diverse, and inclusive workforce with employees from various nationalities
Employee resource groups focused on diversity, sustainability, wellbeing, and social activities
Opportunities for professional development and career growth
Advantages of being part of a global company


Why Kontoor Brands?

At Kontoor, we offer a comprehensive benefit package to fit your lifestyle. Our benefits are crafted with the same care as our products.

When our employees are healthy, secure, and well, they bring their best selves to work. Kontoor Brands supports you with a competitive benefits program that provides choice and flexibility to meet your and your family‚Äôs needs ‚Äì now and in the future. We offer resources to support your physical, emotional, social, and financial wellbeing, plus benefits like discounts on our apparel. Kontoor Brands also provides four weeks of Paid Parental Leave to eligible employees who are new parents, Flexible Fridays, and Tuition Reimbursement.

We are proud to offer a workplace culture centered on equitable opportunities and a sense of belonging for all team members. Here we have a global workforce of high-performing teams that both unlocks our individual uniqueness and harnesses our collaborative talents.

Title: Senior Gas Analyst, Fundamental ‚Äì Switzerland
Description:
Senior Gas Analyst, Fundamental ‚Äì Switzerland




A leading and forward-thinking energy company is looking for a Senior Analyst to join their team. This is a fantastic opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment, analysing Gas markets, supporting optimising trading strategies, and contributing to the this PnL driven desk.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyse UK and European Gas markets, identifying trends, risks, and opportunities.
Develop and maintain forecasting models for demand, generation, and pricing.
Support power trading activities with real-time insights and data-driven recommendations.
Monitor regulatory and policy developments impacting the energy sector.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance data analytics and reporting tools.




What They‚Äôre Looking For:

Strong analytical skills with experience in data modelling, coding (Python/R/SQL), or power system analytics.
Knowledge of UK and European Gas markets, including trading mechanisms and regulations.
2+ years of fundamental Gas analytics experience
Proficiency in working with large datasets and visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI).
A proactive mindset, keen attention to detail, and the ability to communicate insights effectively.
A degree in a relevant field (e.g., Engineering, Economics, Mathematics, or similar).

Title: Analyst, Data & AI Ethics - Research
Description:
Thomson Reuters is transitioning to a content-driven technology company with over a century of experience curating and classifying data and supporting professionals in complex domains that move society forward. With some of the most comprehensive and richly enhanced legal, regulatory, news, and tax data in the world, Thomson Reuters is a leader in delivering technologies that inform the way forward.

The AI Enablement team, part of the Data and Analytics function, is responsible for ensuring governance practices that support the company‚Äôs leadership and delivery of world-class data and AI enabled solutions. The Ethics Research and Compliance analyst will be a critical member of this team, supporting the enterprise with building and delivering ethical and trustworthy technology.

The successful candidate will be responsible for driving awareness and thought leadership on the standards and regulations on the horizon. Working closely with legal and compliance teams, the candidate will support the enterprise-wide awareness of global regulatory trends and developments from leading organizations like the ISO, IEEE, W3C, and OECD. The ideal candidate is a passionate legal and ethics researcher with a knack for influencing audiences through written communication, and other mediums. The candidate will play a critical role in the translation of legal requirements into technical policies and implementation plans.


this is an emerging field of practice, if you are passionate about data and model ethics but don‚Äôt necessarily meet all of the below requirements, you are still strongly encouraged to apply.



About the Role:


Partnering with our legal counsel, you will monitor and report on the latest developments in legislative and regulatory instruments as it pertains to key ethics principles ‚Äì translating into technical policies and requirements
Partnering with our technology teams on the identification, development, and scaling of best practices, tools and techniques to comply and accelerate Thomson Reuters‚Äô leadership in ethical data use and AI
Working closely with Data and Model stewardship network and stakeholders as a specialist consultant on data and AI projects across the organization ‚Äì advising on upcoming legal and related trends and compliance best practices
Ensure that data and AI ethics policies and guiding standards are inclusive of the requirements necessary to meet the growing demands of data and AI related regulation and best practices ‚Äì drafting new policies where necessary
Provide thought leadership, executive summaries, and insights on data and AI ethics and governance matters to colleagues across the organization ‚Äì contribute to educational resources
Participate in data and AI governance policy and standard creation, management, and analyzing potential impacts of policy choices under consideration



About You:


Strong familiarity with developments and trends in ethical data and trustworthy AI ‚Äì e.g. EU, UN, and other major players
Demonstrated understanding of AI governance activities including oversight mechanisms, documentation, development processes
Expert researcher and persuasive communicator ‚Äì primarily in the written word
Strong understanding of global data and AI privacy principles and regulations (experience working with GDPR/Canadian Privacy Act an advantage)
Strong familiarity with data management, ModelOps and traditional software development life cycles ‚Äì an asset
You are a solutions-oriented critical thinker with strong influencing and networking skills
You demonstrate the ability to discover solutions for technical/business issues and to develop actionable insights and recommendations
You have the capability to work autonomously and make independent decisions to meet deliverables with minimal oversight
1-2 years of experience, ideally within the domains of data management and responsible AI, or related work
Considered a strong asset ‚Äì Masters degree or higher - higher education and certifications within the fields of technology law, data management, machine learning and AI, and/or technology ethics



What‚Äôs in it For You?


Hybrid Work Model: We‚Äôve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected.
Flexibility & Work-Life Balance: Flex My Way is a set of supportive workplace policies designed to help manage personal and professional responsibilities, whether caring for family, giving back to the community, or finding time to refresh and reset. This builds upon our flexible work arrangements, including work from anywhere for up to 8 weeks per year, empowering employees to achieve a better work-life balance.
Career Development and Growth: By fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development, we prepare our talent to tackle tomorrow‚Äôs challenges and deliver real-world solutions. Our Grow My Way programming and skills-first approach ensures you have the tools and knowledge to grow, lead, and thrive in an AI-enabled future.
Industry Competitive Benefits: We offer comprehensive benefit plans to include flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days off, access to the Headspace app, retirement savings, tuition reimbursement, employee incentive programs, and resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
Culture: Globally recognized, award-winning reputation for inclusion and belonging, flexibility, work-life balance, and more. We live by our values: Obsess over our Customers, Compete to Win, Challenge (Y)our Thinking, Act Fast / Learn Fast, and Stronger Together.
Social Impact: Make an impact in your community with our Social Impact Institute. We offer employees two paid volunteer days off annually and opportunities to get involved with pro-bono consulting projects and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives.
Making a Real-World Impact:‚ÄØWe are one of the few companies globally that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.



DISCLAIMER

The above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

About Us

Thomson Reuters informs the way forward by bringing together the trusted content and technology that people and organizations need to make the right decisions. We serve professionals across legal, tax, accounting, compliance, government, and media. Our products combine highly specialized software and insights to empower professionals with the data, intelligence, and solutions needed to make informed decisions, and to help institutions in their pursuit of justice, truth, and transparency. Reuters, part of Thomson Reuters, is a world leading provider of trusted journalism and news.

We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness, and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

As a global business, we rely on the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of all employees to deliver on our business goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law. More information on requesting an accommodation here.

Learn more on how to protect yourself from fraudulent job postings here.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness, and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

As a global business, we rely on the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of all employees to deliver on our business goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law. More information on requesting an accommodation here.

Learn more on how to protect yourself from fraudulent job postings here.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

Title: Business Data Analyst (1 year temporary)
Description:
At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

Roche Pharma Switzerland (RPS) is a part of the Roche Group based in Basel. We cover the areas of Marketing & Sales, Medical, Market Access & Healthcare Affairs as well as Governmental Affairs and Quality Assurance for the Swiss market. We have held a leading position in the field of prescription and innovative medicines for many years. Thanks to our performance-oriented and entrepreneurial employees as well as our strong customer focus, we bring new innovative solutions to patients in Switzerland every year.

Within Finance & Business Partnering at Roche Pharma Switzerland, the Business Data Analyst is part of the Strategic Finance and Insights chapter with its mission: As trusted partners we leverage data and actionable insights for strategic decision making to improve customer satisfaction and maximize business value for patients, the healthcare system and Roche.

You will work in a dynamic environment and collaborate across the RPS network (Marketing, Medical, Pipeline, Supply Chain, Regulatory Affairs, Patient Partnership, Quality & Compliance and Market Access), global teams and partner with the company's stakeholders in a key role to shape and advance our analytics capabilities, that enable data-driven decision making, using insights from data, analytics and data science to achieve our ambitions. You will be instrumental to implement and leverage technical advances, to shape our system landscape and integration of data systems, to automate data processes and monitor data quality.

Your business acumen and teamwork skills will allow you to work closely with, and deliver tangible value to, business partners. Having a high level of technical proficiency is also needed to deliver well validated models, insightful analyses, and collaborate with our team of global data scientists, IT-engineers and business analysts.

The Opportunity:

The successful candidate will be effective at integrating data science and analytics into business practice, and visualizations into data-centric products and processes that run at scale and brings a mixture of technical, business and organizational skills.


Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their reporting needs and translate them into effective solutions to influence decisions using insights from data, analytics and data science: a) Development and advancement of analytics b) Statistical data analysis, modeling and data mining as well as application of new approaches c) Using predictive models to generate business insights
Design, develop, and maintain interactive reports and dashboards using front-end tools such as Tableau and SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)
Handling diverse requests from the business, including project requests, ad-hoc analyses, troubleshooting, and report maintenance
Utilize your knowledge of SQL to query and analyze data for reporting and contribute to ETL pipelines and data flows relevant to our reporting environment
Ensure data accuracy and integrity in all reporting deliverables
Project management tasks related to reporting and analytics requests
Contribute to the development and maintenance of documentation related to reports, data sources, and processes


Who you are:

You have experience in performing data exploration to identify actionable insights - including finding trends, key features, feature engineering, discovering and showing relationships and developing visualizations. Furthermore:


Good communication skills, fluent in German & English
Operating in data environments with multiple complex data sources: finding, accessing, cleansing, merging, validating and annotating data
Proficient in developing reports and dashboards using Tableau and SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)
Solid understanding of data visualization best practices and principles
Experience connecting to various data sources and preparing data for reporting
Basic understanding in SQL for data querying and analysis and familiarity with ETL processes and data pipelines
Ability to analyse and understand business requirements and proactive approach to problem-solving


Sounds like the perfect opportunity for you? Apply now online!

Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100‚Äô000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.

Let‚Äôs build a healthier future, together.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Show more

Title: Consultant ‚Äì Digital Data and Analytics (12 months, home-based, remotely) LACRO Region, PFP
Description:
UNICEF works in some of the world‚Äôs toughest places, to reach the world‚Äôs most disadvantaged children. To save their lives. To defend their rights. To help them fulfill their potential.

Across 190 countries and territories, we work for every child, everywhere, every day, to build a better world for everyone.

And we never give up.

For every child, hope

Purpose Of Assignment

As part of UNICEF‚Äôs Digital Strategy, the new Digital Data Analytics Specialist for Latin America and the Caribbean will be responsible for the accurate implementations of the web analytics in the region and for providing statistical and actionable insights for the digital teams.

This Digital Data Analytics Specialist will analyze large volumes of raw data to identify trends that can help improve the performance of digital campaigns in LAC. They will build data products to extract valuable business insights and recommend actions to the digital teams.

Therefore, this role will share commercial responsibility for the results of digital campaigns in the LAC region. This position will sit in the Data & Insights team, under the global Digital Team of the Private Fundraising and Partnership (PFP) in UNICEF.

How can you make a difference?

Scope Of Work

Analytics Reporting and Insights Generation


Support key markets with advanced analytic solutions to address business challenges such as increasing online conversion rates, generating hypothesis for AB testing, understanding conversion paths of digital advertising channels, and Marketing Mix Modelling techniques to measure incremental gains from all fundraising channels, including offline ones such as DRTV and Face-to-Face.
Build digital analytics dashboards encompassing all paid marketing activity, email performance, and other campaign metrics to generate insights that improve online revenue.
Collaborate with the Marketing Activation and Paid Media teams to measure digital performance (e.g. website content, Search Engine Marketing (SEM) advertising, and email communications, including A/B testing) for global campaigns and provide optimization recommendations.
Work with IG team colleagues to enhance donor engagement and retention by leveraging various data sources (CRM, Payment, Online).


Digital Analytics and Fundraising


Provide specialist digital analytics and fundraising expertise to PFP staff in Fundraising Services, Market Development, and beyond.
Contribute to PFP‚Äôs overall strategic planning by integrating digital analytics strategy and supporting its implementation across National Committees and country offices.
Offer specialist local digital knowledge to UNICEF National Committees and country offices within the assigned region as needed.
Support markets in maximizing opportunities by leveraging digital marketing tools and technology.


Analytics and Tracking


Manage and implement digital analytics, champion first-party data tracking methodologies and maintain a strong understanding of data collection best practices for GA4 360, in alignment with Global Data and Analytics team standards.
Possess a solid understanding of digital analytics data and how it integrates with other first-party data sources to create a holistic 360-degree view of donors.
(Desirable) Ability to work in Google BigQuery environment and to build, develop, and maintain data models, reporting systems, data automation systems, dashboards, and performance metrics that support acquisition and retention efforts in the market.
Participate in the implementation roadmap for global digital technology solutions, including platforms for online fundraising, email, analytics, and more.


Support The Digital Talent & Knowledge Management Strategy By


Actively contribute to the development of a global digital analytics community of skilled and engaged professionals who grow, learn, and achieve outstanding results together.
Leverage knowledge management to enhance digital analytics outcomes by identifying, sharing, and replicating best practices and case studies across markets.


Work Assignments Overview


Analytics Reporting and Insights Generation - Support key markets with advanced analytic solutions in order to tackle business problems.
Digital Analytics and Fundraising - Provide specialist digital analytics and fundraising knowledge to PFP staff in Fundraising Services, Market Development (and wider).
Analytics and Tracking - Implement digital analytics, champion first-party data tracking methodologies and best practices.
Digital Talent & Knowledge Management - Actively participate in the digital fundraising community. Identifying, sharing, and replicating case studies and best practices across markets.


Deliverables/Outputs

Deliverables 1 - 100% due by 31 August 2025

Deliver advanced analytic solutions, hypothesis generation for AB testing, and path to conversion of digital advertising channels resulting to improve online conversion rates.

Deliverables 2 - 100% due by 31 October 2025

Develop and deliver digital analytic dashboards, collaborating with marketing teams, and using Marketing Mix Modelling techniques to measure incremental gains from all fundraising channels.

Deliverables 3 - 100% due by 30 November 2025

Deliver recommendation report to optimize digital performance, website content, Search Engine Marketing advertising, and email communications for global campaigns.

Deliverables 4 - 100% due by 31 December 2025

Work with IG team colleagues to deliver donor engagement and retention activities dashboard/report using various data sources (CRM, Payment, Online).

Deliverables 5 - 100% due by 28 February 2026

Provide input into PFP‚Äôs overall strategic planning with a digital analytics strategy and implement it to achieve specific goals, such as improving website traffic, optimizing digital campaigns, and increasing donor.

Deliverables 6 - 100% due by 28 February 2026

Leverage Knowledge Management for improved digital analytics results by identifying, sharing, and replicating case studies and best practices across markets.

Deliverables 7 - 100% due by 31 March 2026

Develop and Deliver data collection best practices & implement digital analytics, champion first-party data tracking methodologies.

Deliverables 8 - 100% due by 30 June 2026

Develop and maintain data models, reporting systems, data automation systems, dashboards, and performance metrics that support in-market acquisition and retention efforts.

To qualify as an advocate for every child you will have‚Ä¶

Education


BSc/BA in Computer Science, Analytics, Mathematician, or relevant field; graduate degree in Data Science or another quantitative field is preferred.


Experience


Five plus (5+) years of proven experience as a Digital OR Data Analyst.
Experience in SQL/Big Query essential.
Experience with commercial KPIs.
Knowledge and experience in digital projects, campaigns, and Google Analytics implementations and reporting essential.
Experience with attribution models.
Analytical mind and business acumen.
Problem-solving aptitude.
Excellent communication and presentation skills. This is crucial for the role, as it will interact with different stakeholders in UNICEF: technical team, digital leader, and management level positions.


Desired


Knowledge of R, SQL, and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java, or C++.
Experience using business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau) and data frameworks (e.g. GCP).
Understanding of quantitative techniques and paid media data.


Language


Fluency in Spanish & English is required. Knowledge of other official UN languages would be an asset.


Remarks

Please indicate your all-inclusive (lump sum) fees against the deliverables listed above in the cover letter, If there is a need for business travel, the travel costs will be covered by UNICEF separately. The office selects the individual based on best value for money.

Payment of professional fees will be based on submission of agreed deliverables. UNICEF reserves the right to withhold payment in case the deliverables submitted are not up to the required standard or in case of delays in submitting the deliverables on the part of the consultant.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted and advance to the next stage of the selection process.

Individuals engaged under a consultancy or individual contract will not be considered ‚Äústaff members‚Äù under the Staff Regulations and Rules of the United Nations and UNICEF‚Äôs policies and procedures, and will not be entitled to benefits provided therein (such as leave entitlements and medical insurance coverage). Their conditions of service will be governed by their contract and the General Conditions of Contracts for the Services of Consultants and Individual Contractors. Consultants and individual contractors are responsible for determining their tax liabilities and for the payment of any taxes and/or duties, in accordance with local or other applicable laws.

The selected candidate is solely responsible to ensure that the visa (applicable) and health insurance required to perform the duties of the contract are valid for the entire period of the contract. Selected candidates are subject to confirmation of fully-vaccinated status against SARS-CoV-2 (Covid-19) with a World Health Organization (WHO)-endorsed vaccine, which must be met prior to taking up the assignment. It does not apply to consultants who will work remotely and are not expected to work on or visit UNICEF premises, programme delivery locations or directly interact with communities UNICEF works with, nor to travel to perform functions for UNICEF for the duration of their consultancy contracts.

For every Child, you demonstrate‚Ä¶

UNICEF's values of Care, Respect, Integrity, Trust, Accountability, and Sustainability (CRITAS).

To view our competency framework, please visit‚ÄØ here.

UNICEF is committed to diversity and inclusion within its workforce, and encourages all candidates, irrespective of gender, nationality, religious or ethnic background, and persons with disabilities, to apply to become a part of the organization. To create a more inclusive workplace, UNICEF offers paid parental leave, breastfeeding breaks, and reasonable accommodation for persons with disabilities. UNICEF strongly encourages the use of flexible working arrangements. Click here to learn more about flexible work arrangements, well-being, and benefits.

According to the UN Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (UNCRPD), persons with disabilities include those who have long-term physical, mental, intellectual, or sensory impairments which, in interaction with various barriers, may hinder their full and effective participation in society on an equal basis with others. In its Disability Inclusion Policy and Strategy 2022-2030, UNICEF has committed to increase the number of employees with disabilities by 2030. At UNICEF, we provide reasonable accommodation for work-related support requirements of candidates and employees with disabilities. Also, UNICEF has launched a Global Accessibility Helpdesk to strengthen physical and digital accessibility. If you are an applicant with a disability who needs digital accessibility support in completing the online application, please submit your request through the accessibility email button on the UNICEF Careers webpage Accessibility | UNICEF.

UNICEF does not hire candidates who are married to children (persons under 18). UNICEF has a zero-tolerance policy on conduct that is incompatible with the aims and objectives of the United Nations and UNICEF, including sexual exploitation and abuse, sexual harassment, abuse of authority and discrimination based on gender, nationality, age, race, sexual orientation, religious or ethnic background or disabilities. UNICEF is committed to promote the protection and safeguarding of all children. All selected candidates will, therefore, undergo rigorous reference and background checks, and will be expected to adhere to these standards and principles. Background checks will include the verification of academic credential(s) and employment history. Selected candidates may be required to provide additional information to conduct a background check, and selected candidates with disabilities may be requested to submit supporting documentation in relation to their disability confidentially.

Title: Cat Data and Tools Analyst (6 month contract)
Description:
PartnerRe is a leading, privately owned, multi-line global reinsurer with a reputation of financial stability and strength, and a commitment to rebuilding businesses and communities after risk events around the world.



Our mission is to continue to be a financially stable and predictable business partner, supporting our clients with solutions tailored to their needs, delivering superior returns to our owner, providing rewarding opportunities for our people and making a positive contribution to society. To achieve this, we live by our values of Integrity, Performance, Collaboration, Straightforward Communication and Respect and Care.



Core to The PartnerRe Experience is our global nature. No matter where you sit in the company, you are part of something bigger. Our teams represent our truly international mindset, forging connections across office locations and all levels of the organization and building a network of mutual success. The result is a day-to-day experience that will allow you to:



Shape your own career



Grow in a supportive environment



Connect with a community of experts



Make an impact



View Home - PartnerRe Experience e-book to find out more about what it‚Äôs like to work at PartnerRe.



We are always looking for bright, proactive individuals to join our team!



Please follow our Careers page for all updates on new positions. We look forward to receiving your application.



PartnerRe is an equal opportunities employer.



Please join our company LinkedIn Page for all updates on new positions that are coming live.





Job Description



About this job:



The position is within the Cat Tools and Technology team, which is part of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office responsible for research, modeling, pricing, and portfolio analytics of natural catastrophes (Cat).



The Tools and Technology team is leading the developments of all the Cat applications in collaboration with IT to drive innovation and efficiency in managing risk of natural catastrophes.







About the role:



This temporary role supports the Cat Tools and Technology team in ongoing projects focusing on improving the reporting and analytics capabilities of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office unit.



In more detail your main tasks are to:



Enhance our existing reporting dashboard to improve efficiency and accuracy in assessing data quality and drivers of portfolio changes.
Replace existing Excel reports and integrate them into R Shiny dashboard.
Automate the production of existing reports through R Markdown.

The role will be based in Zurich.





Qualifications



About you:



You are passionate to apply your strong quantitative skills to the development of tools supporting the automation of processes and delivering business solutions.



The ideal candidate would have the following qualifications and personal qualities:



Master degree in computer science, data science, natural sciences (Climatology, Hydrology, Seismology, or similar), or a related quantitative field
Strong programming skills in R or Python and knowledge in databases (e.g., SQL or Snowflake)
Knowledge of R Shiny and R Markdown is a plus
Interest in data manipulation and data visualization
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Pro-active, solution oriented with a high level of self initiative
Ability to work well in a team and to contribute towards common goals
Proficient (written and verbal) in English


Additional Information











PartnerRe provides a working environment in which diversity is valued, where all employees feel welcome, respected, and empowered to perform at their best. We invite you to learn more about D&I at PartnerRe.



Thank you,



PartnerRe Hiring Team
